loans.name: 06-03-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Đợi has a retail business selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  Đợi is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Đợi is the group leader of the 06-03-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Đợi supports 2 dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Đợi's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Đợi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Đợi faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Đợi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Kean's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district of Cambodia, Kean is 54 years old and married. She has five children. 

The main sources of family income are from farming rice and growing cassava, which she has been engaged in for twenty years. She can earn approximately 27,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The low price for cassava at the market is the main challenge. 

Kean has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other members are the first-cycle clients with VisionFund. She fully paid back the loan and it has helped her to maintain her production on time. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava and rice plantation business. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive and profitable so as to sell it for a high price in order to better her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava and rice plantation business.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.ru:
Зоя торгует на одном из самых крупных вещевых рынков, а также в местном Торговом доме. У нее - 3 торговые точки. Зоя реализует женскую одежду: женские кофты, блузы, пиджаки, юбки, штаны. Торговая точка Зои очень удачно расположена на рынке, где покупатели не пройдут мимо. К тому же Зоя - очень вежливая женщина, порядочная, всегда находится на своем торговом месте.
Эта сумма понадобилась Зое для очередной поездки в Харьков для увеличения ассортимента товара и закупки женских осенних кофт и пиджаков.
texts.en: Zoya works in one of the biggest flea markets, as well as in a local shopping mall.  She has three trading points and she sells women's clothing: blazers, jackets, skirts and pants.  Her trading points are very well-positioned in high-traffic areas of the market.  Zoya herself is a very polite woman who is organized and always in her trading stall.  She needs this loan to make a routine trip to Kharkiv to increase her range of goods and to buy women's jackets and blazers for fall.

loans.use: to buy women's autumn jackets and blazers.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita of Labo, Ozamis City has been raising pigs for more than 3 years and earns 2,000 per month. She’s 55 years old now yet continues to hang on with her piggery to provide for her 3 children. She been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In order to enhance her livestock for selling, she is borrowing an amount of PHP 2,500 from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Florita hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for her piggery.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia es madre soltera cabeza de hogar de su hijo de 6 años de edad ya que el padre de su hijo la abandonó hace un tiempo dejándola a cargo de todas las responsabilidades del hogar. Como conseguir un empleo era muy difícil, además de que debía cuidar su hijo porque no tiene quién se lo cuide, Maria Eugenia encontró la oportunidad de generar sus ingresos con la venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogos, donde sus principales clientes son sus familiares, vecinos y amigos del sector. La gran dificultad que no le ha permitido seguir creciendo con su negocio es la falta de capital suficiente para responder a todos los grandes pedidos que le hacen, y es por esto que para superar esta dificultad Maria Eugenia busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de uso personal y así poder responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un local comercial donde pueda mejorar sus ingresos y también pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a single mother, head of household.  She has a six-year-old son.  Her son’s father abandoned them some time ago leaving all the home’s responsibilities in her hands.  

Because finding employment was very difficult and besides she had to care for her son because there’s no one else to do so, María Eugenia found a way to generate her own income by selling personal use products via catalogue.  Her main customers are family members, neighbors and friends in the area.  

The great difficulty that’s kept her from growing in her business is the lack of capital sufficient to fill all the large customer orders she has pending and it’s in order to overcome this that María Eugenia is looking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy personal use products and be able to fill pending customer orders.

Her dream is to have a commercial locale someday so she can improve her income and also provide employment for people most in needs.

loans.use: to buy personal use products to fill pending customer orders.

loans.name: Faver Alexander

texts.es:
Faver aprendió la actividad de la reparación de electrodomésticos desde muy joven y así consiguió empleo con el cual aportaba económicamente para su hogar, ya que sus padres eran muy pobres y tenían grandes necesidades económicas. Con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo cada vez más de la actividad hasta que un día decidió montar su propio negocio y trabajar de manera independiente, buscando progresar financieramente. Hace 20 años que inició con su propio negocio y gracias a su esfuerzo ha superado grandes dificultades del camino, hasta el punto que ahora su esposa le colabora en el taller para poder responder a todos los pedidos de los clientes. Con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de los clientes, Faver busca un préstamo para comprar repuestos que necesita y así seguir cumpliendo a los pedidos de los clientes.

Su sueño es salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y su hijo de 1 años. Además sueña con poder comprarse su casa propia y ofrecer un hogar estable para su familia.
texts.en:
Faver learned how to repair household appliances as a young man and continued in this line of work in order to financially support his household. His parents were very poor and had great financial needs. As time passed, he gained more knowledge on the job and one day decided to start his own business so that he could work independently and progress financially.

Faver started his business 20 years ago. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to overcome great hardships in life. His wife now works alongside him in his shop by responding to the requests from all of his customers. In order to meet the demands of his customers, Faver is seeking a loan so that he can buy the spare parts that he needs to fulfill the requests of his customers.

His dream is to move forward and improve the quality of life of his wife and their one-year-old son. In addition, he dreams of buying a house of his own so that he can provide a stable home for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: 03-05-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Đào is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise for resale in the future. Đào has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Đào faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Đào is 57 years old and has no dependents. She works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Đào is the group leader of the 03-05-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. This is Đào's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Đào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise for resale in the future.

loans.name: Naysi's Group

texts.en:
Naysi, age 45, is a farmer living in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Naysi has five children, three of whom are students and still under her responsibility. To provide for her household, she has been engaged in growing cassava on two-hectares of farmland for twenty-five years. The current business earns her about 24,000KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.
 
Naysi’s group is requesting their first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her fellow group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KR each. As the group leader, she is going to utilize her portion to buy fertilizer for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her cassava fruitfully and healthfully so as to sell it for a high price in order to make a living better in her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una persona que ha trabajado durante toda su vida fuertemente para sacar adelante su familia, y esto le ha permitido tener una gran experiencia. En su hogar ofrece el servicio de comidas y alojamiento para estudiantes universitarios, y con esto genera los ingresos que necesita para sostener su casa y su único hijo. Las dificultades económicas siempre han sido una de las más grandes adversidades por las que tiene que pasar, y ahora que su hijo se encuentra estudiando sus gastos aumentan considerablemente; es por eso que buscando prestar un mejor servicio para aumentar sus ventas, Elena necesita un préstamo que le permita comprar sábanas y otra lencería que necesita y arreglar un humedal que tiene en una habitación.

Su sueño es poder trabajar hasta que su salud se lo permita y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Elena is a woman who has worked hard her entire life to support her family from which she’s gained much experience.  She provides room and board services at home for university students and this is how she generates income to support her home and her only son.  

Economic difficulties have always been one of the greatest adversities she’s had to go through and now that her son is studying her expenses have increased considerably which is why she wants to provide better service in order to increase income.  

Elena needs a loan to buy sheets and other linens she needs and to repair the dampness in one of the bedrooms.  Her dream is to be able to keep working as long as her health permits and to move her son forward.

loans.use: to buy sheets and other linens she needs and to repair the dampness in one of the rooms.

loans.name: Choum

texts.en:
Choum is 48 years and married. Her family lives in a rural area of the Kror kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has nine children, four of whom are dependent and still in school. She has earned a living through farming rice on a five-hectare area of farmland for twenty-two years. Her husband also supplements the income by making palm-sugar.

Insufficient water supply is the main challenge for her paddy-field business. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Choum is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to build on her savings to buy a proper tractor for helping her in the rice-field. She hopes this mini-tractor will help her in rice-field so as to grow her rice fruitfully and timely.

loans.use: To buy a proper tractor for helping her in the rice-field

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Kheng, 49, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children, two of whom are students in the local public area. To make a living, she has farmed rice on two-hectares of farmland for seven years and supplements her income by serving breakfast in the local area. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Insufficient water supply for her paddy is the main challenge for her business. 

Kheng has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely repaid back the past loans while the other group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has wisely used the past loans to better support her family's livelihood and sustain her business. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to utilize her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and split a portion of it to spend on buying spices to supporting her breakfast-serving business. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice timely and fruitfully and increase her income so as to better her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is from Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 38 years-old and married with 2 children. To make a living, Vivian has cultivated coconuts for 12 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

Vivian joined GDMPC in 2008. Vivian is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to fund her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis Miguel es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad que adquirió el gusto por las salas de belleza de su madre quien siempre se dedicó a esta actividad. Como aprendió desde muy temprano, hace un tiempo decidió abrir un salón de belleza propio y así inició con su propio negocio el cual lo enfocó hacia la atención de niños porque en el sector no había un negocio así. Con mucho esfuerzo ha venido superando las dificultades de capital que tiene en su negocio y ahora que tiene buenas ventas, Luis Miguel busca un préstamo para comprar una silla de motilar en forma de carrito y una sala de espera para ofrecerles a sus clientes una mejor atención.

De esta forma podrá aumentar sus ventas por tener un negocio más atractivo y poco a poco seguirá progresando y sacando adelante sus padres que siempre han padecido dificultades económicas.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is a young entrepreneur who is 20 years of age. He acquired a liking for beauty salons since his mother was always in this line of work. Luis learned to work at a very young age and some time ago decided to open his own beauty salon. When he started his business, he decided to focus on providing children’s services since there was no other business like this in the area. Through great effort, he has been able to overcome difficulties resulting from the flow of capital into his business and now he has good sales.

Luis Miguel is seeking a loan so that he can buy a modular barber’s chair that is shaped like a small car and waiting room chairs so that he can offer better service to his customers. In this manner, he hopes to increase his sales and have a more appealing business. As a result, he hopes to continue making steady progress and assist his parents who have always faced financial difficulty.

loans.use: to buy a modular barber's chair and waiting room chairs.

loans.name: Maria Celina

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que se caracteriza por querer ayudar a las demás personas, y esto le ha permitido ayudar a progresar a muchas personas de su sector que tenían grandes dificultades y ahora pueden contar con un empleo. Desde hace unos 17 años Maria montó un taller de confección en su casa buscando generar ingresos para aportar en su familia, y al ver que con este negocio le estaba yendo bien e iba creciendo, comenzó a generar empleo el cual lo ofrecía a las madres solteras cabezas de hogar de su sector. Ahora su taller es un taller de confección más grande donde tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a la escasez económica Maria busca un préstamo para comprar hilos, agujas, telas y realizar el mantenimiento que sus máquinas necesitan para confeccionar los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. 

Su sueño es seguir sacando adelante este taller de confección y continuar generando más empleo para las madres solteras cabezas de familia que necesitan de unos ingresos. Además, espera que en su hogar su esposo y sus 3 hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a woman who is noted for wanting to help others which has led her to help many in her sector who were in dire straits and who now can count on having employment.  About 17 years ago María set up her sewing workshop at home looking for a way to generate family income.  

Seeing that the business was doing well and was growing, she started to generate employment that she’d offer to single mother, heads of household in her sector.  Now, her workshop is a larger shop and she has large customer orders.  However, due to María's limited economic resources she’s looking for financing to be able to buy thread, needles and fabric and to be able to service the sewing machines needed to fill her pending customer orders.

Her dream is to continue moving the workshop ahead and to continue generating more jobs for single mother, heads of household who need to earn income.  In addition, she hopes her home consisting of her husband and three children will have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Kharitina

texts.ru:
Харитина торгует на крупном местном рынке, продает живые цветы и домашние растения. Ее торговая точка – цветочный павильон - работает круглосуточно. Расположен павильон очень удачно, место хорошо проходимое. Харитина - трудолюбива, постоянна в торговле, честная и добрая.
Дополнительные средства понадобились Харитине для очередной закупки живых цветов из Харькова.
texts.en: Kharitina works in a large local market where she sells live flowers and houseplants.  Her trading point, the flower pavilion, is open 24 hours a day.  The pavilion is in a very good, high-traffic location.  Kharitina is diligent, always at work, honest and pleasant.  She needs this loan to purchase her next batch of live flowers in Kharkiv.

loans.use: to buy a batch of live flowers wholesale in Kharkiv.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en: Pablo is from Nagrumbuan. He is 50 years old and is married with six children. He works hard to give his family a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income and will allow him to support his children and extended family. Pablo has been engaged in farming. He usually plants and harvests rice and the sells it to buyers. According to him, the income from his business will help him to cope with the needs of his family. Thus, Pablo wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 45,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested for the further growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
Maria aprendió la actividad de la preparación de comidas rápidas trabajando en un restaurante durante muchos años; y ya cuando se le terminó el contrato, con unos ahorros montó su propio puesto de venta de comidas rápidas al frente de su casa. Con este negocio puede seguir generando los ingresos que necesita en su hogar para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos de 15 y 19 años de edad. Ya lleva 6 meses con su propio puesto de venta de comidas rápidas y gracias a su esfuerzo y las extensas jornadas que trabaja, ha podido sacarlo adelante y superar las dificultades de capital que tiene en el negocio; sin embargo ahora que busca mejorar sus ventas, Maria acude a un préstamo para comprar insumos para la preparación de las comidas rápidas y comprar gaseosas para ofrecer junto a las comidas.

Así espera aumentar sus ventas considerablemente y por ende los ingresos para su hogar. Su sueño es lograr ubicarse dentro de un local en el centro de la ciudad donde pueda tener mayores ingresos y así ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Maria learned this trade of preparing fast food working in a restaurant for many years; when she finished her contract she set up her own fast food stall in front of her house with some savings. With this business she can continue generating the earnings that she needs in her home to get her children ahead who are 15 and 19 years old. She now has had her own food stall for six months and thanks to her efforts and the extensive hours that she works, she has been able to move forward and overcome the difficulties in obtaining capital for her business. However, she now looks to improve her sales. Maria would use the loan to buy supplies to prepare fast food and to buy soft drinks to offer alongside the food. 

In this way she hopes to considerably increase her sales and her household earnings. Her dream is to locate her stall in a locale in the downtown area of the city where she could have better earnings and offer a better quality life to her two children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare fast food and soft drinks to offer with her food.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is 41 years old and engaged in the hog-fattening business as his primary source of income. He is blessed with three children and it is hard for him to promote their living with all their needs, especially their education. Therefore, he usually feels he has insufficient funds.

He just earns PHP 5,000 each time he sells his hogs and he aspires to increase his sales. Now, he is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy vitamins for his hogs and two more hogs as additional sources of sales. He hopes that through his hard work and this loan, he will have better living conditions and be able to promote the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and two more hogs

loans.name: Kimsol's Group

texts.en:
Kimsol lives in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She is married with seven children, five of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Growing rice is the main source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for 18 years. Beside this, she also supplements her income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 300,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Kimsol received her first loan from VisionFund a cycle ago. She successfully repaid the past loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihoods. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. Kimsol, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and use a portion of it to pay labor fees for transplanting her rice seedlings. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Chhoern

texts.en:
Chhoern is a 60-year-old widowed mother of four children. She still has one granddaughter to take care of who is still in school.  She lives in a rural area of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, Chhoern has been involving in growing cassava for 44 years. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. She manages her to save about 15,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Insufficient working capital is the main challenge for her business. 

Chhoern has been with VisionFund for five cycles and fully paid back her prior loans, which have helped her to expand her plantation business. Now she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 650,000 KHR. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and cassava seeds for her cassava business and use a portion of it to pay labor fees for plowing the field. She hopes to grow her cassava fruitfully and timely in order to sell it for a good price and keep her granddaughter in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cassava seeds

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru:
Роман торгует на авторынке, продает автозапчасти для автомобилей, мотоциклов. У него удачно расположена торговая точка, есть постоянные покупатели, клиенты которые не один год обслуживаются именно у Романа. Как предприниматель Роман - порядочен, всегда пунктуален, трудолюбив.
Кредит понадобился Роману для приобретения автозапчастей к автомобилям российского производства, также запчасти к отечественным авто, светооптика, лампочки, радиаторы, ксеноны.
texts.en: Roman works in the auto market selling auto parts for cars and motorcycles.  He has a well-located trading point where there are always passers-by and clients who have a long-running relationship with Roman.  As an entrepreneur, Roman is orderly, always punctual and hard-working.  He needs this loan to purchase auto parts for Russian and domestic automobiles, bulbs, lights, radiators and xenon.

loans.use: to buy auto parks for Russian cars, parts for domestic cars, bulbs, lights, radiators and xenon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her three employees on time.

loans.name: Dora Cecilia

texts.es:
Gloria es una persona muy luchadora que con la situación de que uno de sus hijos estaba muy enfermo y se encontró hospitalizado durante casi un año, tuvo que montar un negocio para poder ayudar con los aportes económicos de su hogar y sostener así los gastos médicos de su hijo. Fue así como desde hace 8 años montó una venta de helados en un lugar adecuado en su propia casa y pese a que no contaba con mucho capital su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir saliendo adelante poco a poco. Actualmente ha podido ver como sus ventas mejoran y es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar insumos que necesita para la preparación de los helados y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

Su sueño es salir adelante con este negocio y mejorar los ingresos que aporta en su familia para que su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria is a very tenacious woman.  Facing a situation of having an ill child who was hospitalized for almost a year, Gloria needed to start a business to help with household expenses and pay for her son’s medical treatment.  This is how 8 years ago she started to sell ice-cream in a space at home she set aside for this purpose.  Despite not having much capital her effort has made it possible for her to gradually move ahead.  Seeing her sales improve presently, she’s looking for financing to buy ingredients she needs to make the ice-cream and meet customer demand.  Her dream is to move ahead with the business and improve the income she contributes to her family so that her husband and two children who are 15 and 10 years old can have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to make ice-cream.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es:
Pedro anteriormente trabaja en un billar como empleado, y con la experiencia que adquirió decidió montar su propio negocio con unos pequeños ahorros que tenía y poco a poco fue mejorándolo hasta el día de hoy. Con su negocio genera los ingresos que necesita en su hogar para el sostenimiento de su esposa y sus 4 hijos, y aunque los ingresos no son muy altos si le permite tener una calidad de vida digna. En su negocio vende licores, snack y otros productos de consumo, y como no cuenta con un capital suficiente, Pedro busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de licores y snack para seguir ofreciendo un buen surtido a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder sacar este negocio mejorando sus ingresos y tener su local propio para no tener que pagar arriendo.
texts.en:
Pedro used to work as an employee in a billiards hall and with the experience he acquired decided to open his own business using the little savings he had.  It’s been gradually improving to this day.  He generates income in his business that he needs for his home to support his wife and four children.  Although income isn’t very high, it does permit him to live with dignity.

He also sells liquor, snacks and other consumer goods in his business but since he does not have adequate capital, Pedro is looking for a loan to buy an assortment of liquor and snacks to continue to offer a good selection to his customers.  His dream is to move the business forward improving his income and eventually have a locale of his own to save on rental costs.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of liquor and snacks.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
Marino es un gran artista que desde hace 15 años inició su negocio de fabricación de cuadros, actividad que aprendió empíricamente pero que gracias a la experiencia que tiene es reconocido por ofrecer muy buena calidad. Pese a que su negocio lo inició con muy bajo capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir saliendo adelante y hoy día tiene la oportunidad de generar un empleo para una persona que le ayuda, y gracias a la calidad de sus cuadros pintados sus ventas han venido creciendo últimamente. Dentro de unos días Marino participará en una feria, y para poder responder a la demanda que allí hay, busca un préstamo que le permita comprar insumos como madera y pintura para fabricar los cuadros con los cuales responder a la demanda de la feria.

Su sueño es poder dar a conocer aún más su oficio y comercializarlo a un mejor precio, pues a veces sus ingresos son muy bajos por la alta competencia.
texts.en:
Marino is a great artist who has been working for the last 15 years making paintings, an activity he learned on his own but that thanks to the experience he’s attained has become very well-known for offering very good quality.  

Despite having started the business with very little capital, his efforts have made it possible for him to move ahead and today he’s able to provide employment for one person who helps him.  

Thanks to the quality of the paintings he paints his sales have grown recently.  In a few days, Marino will take part in a fair and in order to meet demand there he’s looking for financing to buy supplies like wood and paint to manufacture the paintings he hopes to respond to demand with.  His dream is to become better known and to sell for higher prices because sometimes his income is low due to the high level of competition.

loans.use: to buy supplies like wood and paint.

loans.name: Anibal De Jesus

texts.es:
Anibal tiene un puesto de venta de comidas rápidas desde hace 17 años y es con este que genera los ingresos que necesita en su hogar para el sostenimiento de su esposa y sus 3 hijos a quienes les brinda una educación escolar. El negocio cuando lo inició estaba muy mal abastecido y sufría grandes dificultades, pero con el tiempo lo ha venido mejorando y ahora tiene la oportunidad de tener un triciclo el cual es su carrito para vender las comidas rápidas. En el momento está presentando la dificultad de que se ha dañado el motor del carrito, por lo que no puede llegar a unos colegios a tiempo donde sus productos se venden muy bien; buscando superar esta dificultad, Anibal busca un préstamo para arreglar el motor de su carrito de comidas rápidas y poder así llegar a los colegios a tiempo donde sus productos se venden muy bien.

De esta manera espera recuperar las ventas perdidas por no llegar a tiempo a los colegios y su familia podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Anibal sueña con salir adelante y tener su propia empresa de jugos.
texts.en:
Aníbal has had a fast-food stand for the last 17 years that generates income he needs for his home to support his wife and three children he’s providing schooling for. When he started the business it was very poorly stocked and he’d go through great difficulties but in time he’s been improving it and now he has the opportunity to have a three-wheel cart that’s the cart he uses to sell fast-food.

At present, he’s facing the difficulty that the carts motor is damaged so he’s unable to reach some of the schools on time where his products sell very well.  Seeking to overcome this obstacle, Aníbal is looking for a loan to repair his fast-food cart’s engine so that he can get to the schools on time where his products sell very well.

In this way he hopes to recuperate lost sales due to his not arriving on time at the schools and his family will be able to enjoy improved quality of life.  Aníbal dreams with getting ahead and owning his own juice firm.

loans.use: to repair his food cart's engine.

loans.name: Tapita

texts.fr: Tapita est un jeune femme de 37 ans, mère de famille. Elle a ouvert une alimentation qu'elle gère depuis 2 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et son accueil chaleureux et ses bons rapports avec son voisinage,elle a pu acquérir une très grande clientèle. L'augmentation croissante de sa clientèle rend son offre inférieure à la demande d'ou l'importance de ce crédit dans son activité.Grâce à lui elle pourra acheter le crédit de communication et les produits de premières nécessités(riz, huiles savons, sucre...) en grande ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle, d'augmenter ses ventes ainsi sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille dont elle en a la charge.
texts.en:
Tapita, age 37, is a young woman who is raising a family.  She has opened a grocery store in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city, and she has been managing it for the past two years. 

Thanks to her experience in this field, to her warm welcome, and to her good neighborly relationships, she has been able to attract a large number of customers.  However, because her customer base has increased so much, demand is now higher than supply, and this is why she now needs a loan to sustain her activity.  

Thanks to this loan, Tapita will be able to buy communication credit and staple goods such as rice, oil, soap, sugar etc..  She will buy these products in large quantities, which will allow her to properly meet the needs of her customers and to increase her sales and profit margin.  

She will reinvest part of her profits in the business, while the rest will be used to meet her needs and those of her family, for whom she cares.

loans.use: to buy communication credit and staple goods (rice, oil, soap, sugar...)

loans.name: Cherie Ann

texts.en:
Cherie Ann, 39, is single and has one child. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been in business for four months and earns about 15,000 PHP a month doing so.

Recently Cherie Ann joined GDMPC. She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy the ingredients needed to make the food she sells. She plans to use her extra profits from her enterprise to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Diana Rose

texts.en:
Diana Rose is an industrious housewife and the mother of one child. Because of her hard work in her shop, her family is able to eat three times a day.

Diana Rose is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 from ASKI to buy extra cooking oil, candies and bread to sell in her store. She is aiming for more income from her store to be saved and used for the future education of her child.

loans.use: to buy extra cooking oil, candies and bread to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baskets of chicken.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria hace 4 años vendía productos de uso personal a través de catálogos y decidió montar un pequeño negocio donde pudiera venderlos directamente, así poco a poco al ver la necesidad del sector fue incluyendo productos de papelería y ahora su negocio ofrece una gran cantidad de productos de papelería a sus clientes. Con este negocio tiene la posibilidad de generar mayores ingresos para su familia y así puede ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar. Como hace un tiempo se le dañó la fotocopiadora, no ha podido volver a prestar este servicio, y al ver que ya sus ingresos se están viendo fuertemente afectados, Maria necesita un préstamo para reparar la fotocopiadora de su papelería y también comprar surtido para el negocio.

Su sueño es poder ubicar el negocio en un local separado de su casa y así ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Four years ago, Maria was selling personal use products through catalogs, and decided to set up a small business where she could sell them directly. 

Little by little, seeing need in the neighborhood. she began including stationery products. and now her business offers a great quantity of stationery products to her customers. 

With this business she has the chance to generate greater income for her family, and this way can provide a better quality of life in her home. As some time ago the photocopier was damaged, she not been able to offer this service again. Seeing that her income is already being severely affected, María  needs a loan to repair the photocopier in her stationery store, and also to buy supplies for the business. 

Her dream is to be able to locate her business in premises separate from her house, and this way offer her family a better quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: To repair the photocopier in her stationery store, and also to buy supplies for the business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 49 years old and married. She is from Labo, Ozamis City. She has 4 grown children who have helped her in taking care of their bananas. They have been growing bananas for 10 years and earn 3,000 a month. In 2007, Perlita joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 6,000 to purchase fertilizer, and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and for weeding costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her establishment, fixing her water outlets and making internal improvements

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар женщина-труженица, работает дворником на комбинате благоустройства более 3 года.  Муж  водитель грузового такси и перевозит строительные материалы.  У Гавхар два взрослых сына, которые имеют свои семьи, но живут вместе с родителями.   Сыновья тоже работают, но так как семья очень большая, все доходы почти тратятся на проживание. У Гавхар впереди много расходов по различным мероприятиям и она хочет получить кредит и с заработной платы погашать его частично, что очень выгодно ей.  Гавхар получает третий кредит и все эти кредиты использовала на семейные нужды.  Очередной кредит запрашивает на покупку авиабилета для сына,который едет за пределы города на заработки.
texts.en: Gavhar is a woman who has worked as a janitor at the public services plant for more than three years.  Her husband is a truck driver; he transports building materials.  Gavhar has two grown sons who have their own families, though they still live at home.  Her sons also work, but because their families are large they spent nearly all their income on their living expenses.  Gavhar has many expenses ahead of her for her various activities and she is asking for a loan which she will pay back in installments, which is very convenient for her.  This would be Gavhar's third loan, and she has used all her loans to fulfill her family's needs.  With this loan, she would like to purchase a plane ticket for her son who is going out of town for work.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her son.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana
2012-285
500.000

Marina tiene 44 años,  mujer humilde, trabajadora, dedicada a su familia. Se dedica a la costura  desde su juventud, se ha capacitado y adquirido máquinas caseras con capital propio y ayuda de su esposo.  Actualmente vive con él y sus 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son menores de edad, todos estudian actualmente.

Su motivación mayor son sus hijos, a los cuales dedican su trabajo,  para que estudien y se superen. Con este préstamo se pretende adquirir materia prima y mercadería para aumentar los ingresos;  además de apoyar a una nicaragüense que tiene 6 hijos, con la venta de mercadería, como revendedora. Persona de buenos principios y buenas intenciones para con su familia y los demás.

Desde hace 2 años adquiere maquinas caseras  para elaborar prendas y accesorios con los que apoya al hogar económicamente. Con empeño se ha capacitado y mejorado su técnica. Actualmente vende por catálogo como actividad adicional. 

Es una actividad pequeña, que requiere de capital de trabajo para su crecimiento. Ha aumentado su clientela y mejorado su técnica con cursos de costura. Se proyecta crecimiento con este apoyo económico y otros futuros créditos para mantener la actividad.

 Toda la familia apoya el emprendimiento productivo de doña Mariana. Cuenta con motivación, una cartera de clientas, maquinaria y destreza para la confección y ventas. Dos clientas de Fundación Mujer la motivaron a contactarles y ella espera poder responder con creces este apoyo que se le pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Mariana
2012-285
500.000

Marina is 44 years old.  She is a humble, hard-working woman who is devoted to her family.  She has been sewing since she was a young girl.  She has received training and has acquired domestic machines with her own capital and the help of her husband.  Mariana currently lives with her husband and her three children, two of whom are under 18.  They are all studying.

Mariana's children are her motivation and it is for them that she works, so that they can study and do well in life.  She plans to use this loan to buy materials and merchandise in order to increase her income.  She will also support a Nicaraguan lady who has six children, by selling merchandise as a re-seller.  Mariana is a person with good principles and good intentions toward both her own family and others.

Over the past two years, Mariana has acquired domestic sewing machines for making garments and accessories so that she can financially support her household.  With a lot of determination, she has trained and improved her technique.  She currently makes catalog sales as an additional business.

Mariana's is a small business which requires working capital in order to grow.  She has increased her customer base and improved her technique by taking sewing courses.  She plans to use this financial support to grow her business and to take out future loans to maintain her business.

All the members of her family support Mariana's productive entrepreneurship.  She has motivation, a customer base, machinery and the skill she needs to make her products and sell them.  Two existing clients of Fundación Mujer encouraged her to contact them and she hopes to be able to exceed expectations with the support that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes, drapes, etc.

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
A resident in a rural area of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Khom is a 32-year-old married woman with three daughters. Some of them are school-aged and some are too young to go to school.

Khom raises pigs and grows rice. Because she needs more money to sustain her work, she is leading a group of three women in seeking a 2,300,000 KHR loan from VisionFund. The women are all first-time borrowers.

With 1,000,000 KHR—her portion of the loan—Khom will buy pig feed in order to healthfully raise her pigs. Her ambition is to keep her children in school through third form.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Patricia Maria

texts.es:
Patricia hace muchos años se dedicaba a las labores de aseo en las residencias donde la contrataban, pero un día se cansó de realizar esta labor motivada principalmente por el mal pago que tenía, y así le resultó la oportunidad de montar un puesto donde ofrece el servicio de comidas y bebidas. El negocio lo montó hace unos 10 años y gracias a que está ubicado en una zona industrial tiene la oportunidad de atender a una buena cantidad de clientes, y así poco a poco puede mejorar los ingresos con los que apoya en su hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital que tiene en el negocio, Patricia busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de comidas y bebidas para atener las ventas de a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder sacar este negocio adelante y que continúe siendo la fuente de ingresos más estable que tiene su familia, para que ahorrando poco a poco algún día pueda comprar la casa propia para ofrecer un hogar más estable a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Years ago, Patricia worked cleaning homes, but one day, she got tired this work, mostly because it was badly paid. Then she got the opportunity to start a stand where she sells food and drinks. She started the business ten years ago and thanks to the fact that it is located in an industrial area, she is able to attend to a lot of customers. This way, little by little, she can increase her income, with which she supports her household, her husband and two children. Wanting to overcome the money flow problems that she has in the business, Patricia is seeking a loan to buy a supply of food and drinks to sell to her customers.

Her dream is to move this business forward. She hopes that it will continue to be the most stable source of income for her family, so that little by little she can save and one day buy her own house so that she can offer her children a more stable home.

loans.use: to buy a supply of food and drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fabrice Roméo

texts.fr: Roméo est une jeune homme de 25 ans, fiancé père d'un enfant.Il gère une petite structure dans un quartier de la capitale dans laquelle il vend les téléphones portables et accessoires depuis trois ans. Son petit capital ne lui permet pas d'acheter assez de marchandises, Il est obligé à chaque fois de faire écouler tout son stock avant de s'en procurer un autre d'où sa rupture permanente de stock.Il sollicite ce crédit pour pourvoir augmenter son capital et donc son stock de téléphones, ce qui lui permettra de renouveler son stock sans attendre que l'ancien soit totalement écouler. Il réinvestira une partie du bénefice dans son kiosque et économisera l'autre pour son enfant.
texts.en:
Roméo, age 25, is a young man who is engaged and the father of one child.  He runs a small stall in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city and has been selling cell phones and accessories for the past three years.

His small capital does not allow him to buy large quantities of goods.  He constantly has to sell his entire stock of merchandise before he can buy more, which means that he is always out-of-stock. 

He is requesting this loan to increase his capital and therefore his inventory of cell phones, which will allow him to renew his inventory without having to first sell all his merchandise.

Part of his profits will be reinvested in his stall, while the rest will be saved for his child.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of mobile phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, sauce, meat, and other supplies for her own business

loans.name: Ech

texts.en: Ech is a resident originally from a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province in Cambodia. She is a 52-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom (daughter) is still dependent on her. Ech, with support from her husband, works as a rice farmer on one hectare of farmland to support her family. To add more income to the family, she also raises pigs. Ech has 15 years of experience in her current business, earning approximately 16,000 KHR per day. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR. This will be Ech’s second-cycle loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The first loan that she applied for with VisionFund has helped her unload her family's difficulty and upgrade their livelihood. Her new request will be used to purchase more pigs for raising, and a small portion of it will be used to fix her house. She hopes to earn more income from her business and to fix her house on time, especially for the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her pig business

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Heriberto, es una persona muy trabajadoras y emprendedora, comenta que gracias al préstamo anterior de Kiva pudo trabajar mejor y también cumplir con varios pedidos que tenia, ya que pudo surtirse bien. Comenta que el trabajo que hace es para algún día poder tener su propio local y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
Heriberto solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de guitarras, arpas, sombreros y demás para poder seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que ha recibido ya que gracias a esto ha podido mejorar mucho.
texts.en:
Heriberto is a very hard-working and enterprising person who, thanks to a previous loan from Kiva, has been able to improve his work and also to fulfill various orders he received, by supplying his business well. He commented that the work he does is so that some day he will be able to have his own store and, therefore, be able to continue expanding his business.

Heriberto is requesting a new loan for the purchase of guitars, harps, hats and other merchandise to be able to continue meeting his customers' demands. He is grateful for the help he has received, since thanks to that, he has been able to improve his business greatly.

loans.use: to buy guitars, harps, sombreros, etc.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old mother of four children, Oun has made a living planting cassava on three hectares of farmland for the past fifteen years. She also grows rubber plant seedlings to sell. Her daily income is about 30,000 KHR; of this she is able to set aside about 10,000 KHR a day after expenses.

Oun’s group consists of herself and another woman who lives in the same village. While Oun has once before taken out a loan with VisionFund, her co-member has never done so. Oun fully paid back her first loan that helped her to better support her efforts.

As her group’s leader, Oun is now applying for a new loan. She will use her portion to buy small plastic bags and mulch to use in her rubber plant business. She anticipates her crop yield becoming more profitable.

loans.use: to buy small plastic bags and mulch to use in her rubber plant business.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is 58 years old and is married with one child. Eden and her husband are both farmers. They work hard to lift their child out of poverty. Eden and her husband would like to expand their rice plantation, but they do not have adequate capital. Therefore, Eden is asking for additional capital in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy rice seed, fertilizers and insecticides, as well as pay labor costs required to plant rice. Eden believes that this loan will be an enormous help for them to increase their yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizers and insecticides, as well as pay labor costs required to plant rice

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 62 years old and is married with five children. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past five years, she has run a retail store where she sells personal products in the local community. She earns 10,000 PHP each month. Lourdes joined GDMPC in 2006 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Haydee Claire

texts.en: Haydee Claire is 45 years old, married, and has a child. She owns a business in the planting and harvesting of rice for sale. From this business, she is able to earn about P30,000 every harvest season. She is grateful that her income allows her to help sustain her child and the family's daily needs. She dreams of lifting her family from their poor living conditions. That’s why she works hard in the family rice field. Haydee Claire wants to receive a loan in the amount of P35,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for her rice field. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further grow her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for her rice field

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead in life. She has sold different kinds of banana for more than eight years. Leticia and her husband have been working together to earn their living. The couple aims to educate their youngest son because education is the only inheritance they can give to their children.

Leticia would like to buy more bananas but needs a loan due to an abrupt increase in price. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000.
She hopes to have a better business someday, so she can offer her customers a greater variety of bananas which will enable her to earn a bigger income. In this way, she could help her youngest child finish his degree program and improve their style of living.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for her fruit vending business

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is a business minded person.  She manages her retail store, raises hogs and sells different kinds of groceries within her local community. She is married with three children. Two of her children go to school and the youngest is still an infant.

Ednalyn has run her retail store for 13 years. She is thankful because she can manage her time wisely with the help of her husband. While she manages her retail store and hog raising business her husband is busy running their motorcycle transport and farming their half hectare of rice field. Since their business is growing, Ednalyn is in need of more capital amounting to PHP40,000. This will allow her to purchase more groceries so she can satisfy her customer demands. She hopes for the continuous growth of her businesses so that she can let her children finish their studies and also give them comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her retail store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married to an Overseas Filipino Worker(OFW). The couple have been blessed with one grown up child. Susan lives with her grandchild because her daughter is also an Overseas Filipino Worker. Through the profits from her variety store and what her husband has sent her, they were able to educate their only child.

Susan owns and has run her variety store for one year. She really desires to increase the volume of her merchandise. She has requested a loan of PHP20,000. Susan believes that this loan amount will give her the capability to become a better entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her variety store

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
Margarita inició hace unos meses con su negocio de venta de ropa a través de catálogos debido a que veía la necesidad de colaborar económicamente en su hogar junto con su esposo para poder sostener a sus 5 hijos y brindarles una buena calidad de vida. Inicialmente tenía muy poco capital y esto le dificultó mucho comenzar con la actividad, pero gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido ir poco a poco sacando adelante este negocio y así ha podido ofrecerle a su familia a su familia una mejor calida de vida. Para satisfacer unos grandes pedidos que tiene de los clientes los cuales no ha podido responder por falta de capital, Margarita busca un préstamo para comprar ropa y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su sueño es tener un almacén donde pueda tener su negocio más posicionado y así vender más, de modo que genere ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
A few months ago, Margarita started her own business selling clothing through catalogs. She did so because saw that she needed to contribute financially at home, along with her husband in order to provide a good quality of life to their five children. Initially, she had very little capital and it was very difficult for her to start up, but thanks to her hard work, she has been able to go little by little taking her business forward. In this way, she has been able to offer her family a better quality of life.

In order to fill some large orders her customers have placed, ones that she could not fill previously due to a lack of capital, Margarita is requesting a loan to buy clothes and respond to these large orders. Her dream is to have a store where her business will be better positioned and she can sell more so that she generates income that affords her a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing and respond to the large orders she has from her customers.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng, a 39-year-old rice farmer from Pursat province's Bakan district, is a married mother. She has four children, three of them in school. Heng manages her four hectares of rice farmland with the help of her husband, who also fishes in order to support the entire household. With 12 years of experience in the rice growing business, Heng is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day. However, she sometimes receives a low yield due to floods and pests.

This is the first microloan for all four members of this group, each seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As group leader, Heng is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pig feed. She expects a high yield and fat pigs so that she can earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Barsbold

texts.en:
Barsbold is a 38-year-old married man. He is the father of three children. His two oldest children attend a local secondary school, while his spouse stays home with their one-year-old daughter. The family lives in a small apartment. 

Barsbold teaches haulage truck mechanics, and, besides this work, he operates a training center for which he needs to purchase some facilities and heavy equipment to use with trainees.

loans.use: to purchase necessary heavy equipment for use with trainees.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: Juan tiene 50 años estado civil casado tiene hijos mayores de edad .El comenta que cuando era joven comenzó trabajando en una vulcanizadora pues ya a lo largo que creciendo  se independizo y se hizo su propio negocio que es su taller de arreglar automóviles .Su sueño es poner un taller de carro ultra moderno y completo. Con el préstamo compraría tales cosas como: gata, llaves, aire de comprensor
texts.en: Juan is 50 years old and married. He has grown children. He comments that when he was young, he started working in a tire repair shop, and over time he gradually became independent and set up his own business, which is now his auto repair workshop. His dream is to set up an ultra-modern and complete auto workshop. With the loan, he will buy items such as a jack, wrenches and an air compressor.

loans.use: to buy a jack, wrenches and an air compressor.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta has been separated for more than 12 years. She stands as both father and mother to her four children. She is thankful and blessed because despite her situation as a single mother, she has been able to raise them all.

Vicenta has operated her general store for 12 years. Her profits goes to her daily household expenses and the maintenance of her hog raising business. She is a business minded and industrious woman. She really loves the things she does in her life. Vicenta doesn't want to depend on her four children for help so she works hard to earn a living.

Vicenta has been a good client for two years. Her previous loan had a really great impact in the development of her business. Since she has paid back her previous loan, she has requested another loan in the amount of PHP10,000. She will use this loan to buy various kinds of groceries to keep her business more profitable and productive.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of groceries for her retail store

loans.name: Narcisa  Eusebia

texts.es: Narcisa tiene 53 años estado civil soltera tiene hijos adultos .ella cuenta que empezó vendiendo cosas pequeñas en una tienda como bebidas, en la actualidad tiene una despensa donde vende víveres y cosas como laminas plumas . Su anhelos es que su negocio siga creciendo en venta y ella poderlo ampliarlo mas .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar más vitrina, viveras, bebidas etc.
texts.en: Narcisa is 53 years old and married. She has adult children. She reports that she started selling small items in a store, such as beverages. Currently, she has a shop where she sells groceries and items such as pens and learning materials. Her desire is to see her business keep growing in sales, and to be able to expand it further. With the loan, she would like to buy more display cases, groceries, beverages, etc.

loans.use: to buy more display cases, groceries, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is 55 years old, and she owns and manages a small restaurant in her community. Within a year in this business, she was able to support the studies of her four children. She continues her business to provide a better living for her family. In fact, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy meat, rice, and vegetables.
These goods are a big help in acquiring a higher income each month. She wants to continue increasing her profits in order to continue providing for the education of her children and to achieve success in business. This may cause her family’s living conditions to change for the better.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, and vegetables.

loans.name: Chrep's Group

texts.en:
Chrep, 31, lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has made a living through growing rice for four years. Her daily income is approximately 20,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) to meet the family’s needs. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her rice paddy.

Chrep’s group consists of two members who are first loan-cycle clients with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a loan of 500,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it to spend on gasoline for water pumping. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to better her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, bulk foods and other basic products.

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en:
Chann, 29 years old, is a farmer originally from the Bakan district of Pursat province. She is married and has two sons. Chann and her husband have five hectares of farmland, where they have been growing paddy rice for 15 years. However, she sometimes experiences low crop production, especially during droughts.

Chann, the leader of this 2-member group, is a first-time borrower with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and her co-member is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. Chann will use her portion of the loan to buy additional fertilizer and to pay for water pumping for her field. She highly hopes that she can boost her output gradually and increase her income for her children's sake.

loans.use: To buy additional fertilizer and to pay for water pumping

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha lives in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. She is a 31-year-old mother of four schoolchildren (two daughters and two sons). To tackle her daily food expenses and her children's education, she and her husband grow rice on their three hectares of farmland. During her spare time, Tha raises pigs and her husband works at a construction site to make more income. Tha's average daily income from her businesses is 18,600 KHR. She has been working in these businesses for 10 years.

Tha's group consists of five female members, all first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Tha and one of her co-members are seeking loans of 1,000,000 KHR each, two group members are applying for loans of 500,000 KHR each and the remaining member is requesting 700,000 KHR. As the group leader, Tha will use her loan portion to buy six sacks of fertilizer and pig feed. She hopes to raise her pigs healthily and to make more income so she can enlarge her pig raising business.

loans.use: To buy six sacks of fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Teresa Vilma

texts.es: Teresa tiene 32 años de edad estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijos, ella nos cuenta que hizo curso de estilista desde muy joven, le encanta el mundo de la belleza. Por lo que ahora ese es su medio de trabajo porque ella comercializa productos de belleza ella es estilista su horario de trabajo es cuando una persona la necesite ella va a domicilio. Lo que ella quiere es tener un lugar fijo para estar y también quiere herramientas de bellezas. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: herramientas de bellezas
texts.en: Teresa is 32 years old and single. She has two children. She tells us that she went to beauty school very young; she loves the world of beauty. So now that is her work environment, as she sells beauty products and is a hairstylist. Her work schedule is whenever people need her, she goes to their house. What she wants is to have a permanent place to be, and she also wants beauty tools. With this loan, she wants to buy beauty tools.

loans.use: to purchase beauty tools.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: María tiene 42 años estado civil divorciada  tiene un hijo. Cuenta María que todo inicio hace  17 años en el negocio de venta de productos cosmético .Su meta es ser reconocido por su cremas faciales , perfumes .Con el préstamo ella quiere aumentar los productos como: crema, perfume, jabone etc.
texts.en: María is 42 years old, divorced, and has a son. María says that her cosmetic sales business began 17 years ago. Her goal is to be known for facial creams and perfumes. With the loan, she wants to increase her products such as creams, perfumes, soap, etc.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, soap, etc.

loans.name: Alejandro Isabel

texts.es: Microempresario de éxitos lleva 6 préstamos de inversión, con la institución su negocio es panadería que la inicio  desde hace 12 años, cuenta con tres trabajadores. Inicio su negocio con pocos ingresos y con muchas luchas y retos fue creciendo su negocio hasta lograr sus metas con ahínco y disciplina. Con el crédito anterior compro una moto de dos ruedas que le sirve para movilizarse y dar atención de cobertura de nuevos clientes que le demandaban su producto  donde no tenía presencia. Con el crédito actual lo invertirá en la reparación de su horno que está dañado y compra de materia prima como harina principalmente.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a successful microentrepeneur and has taken six investment loans from the institution.  He has a bakery that he began twelve years ago, and has three employees.  He began his business with little income and a lot of struggles and challenges.  He is growing his business to achieve his goals through hard work and discipline.  

With his previous loan, he bought a two-wheeled motorbike; this allows him to reach new customers who ask for his products in areas where he did not have a presence.  

With this loan, he will invest in the repair of his broken oven and will buy raw ingredients, mainly flour.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients, like flour and yeast, and to repair his broken oven.

loans.name: Nory's Group

texts.en: A rural villager from Bakan district, Nory is one of the breadwinners in a family that includes three schoolchildren. She is engaged in rice cropping on 2.5 hectares of farmland. Besides helping on the rice farm, her husband helps her to earn more income via catching fish to sell. The current business that she has been with for 11 years earns her about 15,500 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. For her, flooding remains a big challenge. Having never been with Vision Fund (Kiva's partner) before, she forms a group of three members who are first loan-cycle clients and are seeking the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice and cast net for her husband to catch more fish. She hopes to receive more yield than before and uplift her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice and cast net for her husband to catch more fish.

loans.name: Tatiana Mireya

texts.es: Tatiana tiene 28años  estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años cuando su pareja la dejo ella trato de buscar trabajo pero nadie le dio la oportunidad de trabajar. Entonces ella tomo la decisión de salir adelante por si sola ya que compro mercadería como, colchas, sabanas para vendérsela a sus vecinos del barrio de donde ella vivía .actualmente ella trabaja junto a una amiga y sale a la 8:00am hasta las 5:pm .su sueño es tener el local para venderlas en su propio local .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar sabanas, colchas , almohadas al por mayor
texts.en:
Tatiana is 28 years old and single. She has one five-year-old son. When her partner left her, she tried to find a job, but no one gave her the opportunity to work. So, she made up her mind to make a living on her own. She bought merchandise like bedspreads and linens to sell to her neighbors in the area where she was living. Currently, she works together with a friend, and she goes out selling from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. 

Tatiana's dream is to to sell her goods in a shop of her own. With this loan, she wants to buy sheets, bedspreads, and pillows from a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy linens, bedspreads, and pillows from a wholesaler.

loans.name: Procy

texts.en: Procy is a dignified 53-year-old married woman who works in rice production. Her husband is also a farmer who helps her to cultivate their family's land. Procy wants to give her family a good life. She will do anything to lift them out of poverty, and has therefore asked for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings. Procy believes that this loan will be a tremendous help to her in increasing her farm yield.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 26-year-old businesswoman who is married to Daniel. They currently have no children. Catherine has been running a beauty shop for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,500 which she uses to support her family. 

Catherine is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, having repaid the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy more cosmetics and beauty products to sell. Catherine will use the anticipated profit from the business to one day educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Solongojargal

texts.en: Solongojargal is 51 years old and lives alone in her own small house. She is a masseuse and has her own customers. Solongojargal is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to do some work on her house before the cold winter season. She is really thankful to all kind Kiva lenders who will give her an opportunity to live alone safely during the winter season.

loans.use: to do some work on her small house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 39-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Bernadette, a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of 11,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to use in his farm for better yields. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to expand the farming business by buying another farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Paradizo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Shamamba, présidente adjointe du groupe d’affaire Paradizo, est  un entrepreneur routinier, âgée d’environ 32 ans, femme vivant seule  sans conjoint, alors, mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des habits usagers (friperie). Elle commença son business avec son fonds propre reçu par son petit ami. Elle fut initiée par sa mère dans ce business de friperie. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de base de l’IMF Hekima  en 2008 pour renforcer son capital. Elle vient de réaliser 11 cycles dans ce programme de microcrédit.  Elle installe ses produits dans un petit marché au quartier dit ‘’TMK’’. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 1 ballon de friperie. En plus, elle ambitionne devenir commerçante grossiste des friperies. La cliente salut l’initiative de Hekima qui soutient les pauvres  femmes non bancables.
texts.en: The client Shamamba, co-president of the business group Paradizo, is a regular entrepreneur, about 32 years old, and lives alone without a husband. She is the mother of four children.  She sells second-hand clothing.  She started her business with funds given to her by her boyfriend.  She got involved in the business of selling second-hand clothing through her mother.  Later, in 2008, she benefitted from a loan through IMF Hekima in order to build up her capital.  She has been through 11 loan cycles with this micro-finance program.  She sets her merchandise up at a small market in the quarter known as “TMK.”  This new loan will allow her to buy herself a bundle of used clothing.  In addition, her goal is to become a wholesaler in used clothing.   The client praises the initiative of Hekima to support poor women who are excluded from the banking system.

loans.use: to buy one bundle of used clothing.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María de estado civil casada tiene una hija de 15 años .Ella cuenta que siempre le ha gustado las manualidades, ya que ella ingreso a un cuso y comenzó con este negocio, elaborando, cojines, toallas, bordados. Ella no tiene horario fijo para su trabajo por lo que más común los comercializa en las tardes. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: mas materiales, pinturas y telas
texts.en:
María is married and has one 15-year-old daughter. She says that she has always liked handicrafts, so she took a class and started this business making cushions, towels, and embroidery. She doesn't have a fixed schedule for doing her work, which she sells mostly in the afternoons. 

With this loan, she wants to buy more materials, paints, and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy more materials, paints, and fabrics.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 26-year-old businessman. He is married to Perris, a farmer. They are blessed with one child. He has been running a spare parts business for the past three years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD, after repaying his previous loan successfully. Samuel will use the loan to buy more spare parts.
With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema, 33 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She has a rice farm, which she has owned for almost 10 years. From the last crop, her net income was 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

She's asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds for her rice farm. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to Rema, who sees the loans as her only opportunity to develop her agricultural business and improve her financial security.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds for her rice farm.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, 27 years old, is a green grocer in Mombasa. He is married to Mary. Emmanuel has been selling groceries successfully for the past three years. This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use it to purchase more kale, tomatoes, cabbages and potatoes for his business. Emmanuel will use the proceeds to start a car washing business. He hopes to do well in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, cabbages and potatoes

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland, 42 years old, is married and has three children. He works hard to provide for his family's daily needs. Roland has been involved in the farming business for seven years. He has 2 hectares of land where he grows rice. He sells his harvest to traders and earned a net income of 40,000 PHP from the last cropping. The income will help him cope with his family's needs and give his children a good life. Roland wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 35,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get the requested amount to further grow his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en: Zohrab is a 46-year-old father of 2 children. He lives in Agsu, Azerbaijan and owns a small shop that sells vegetables and fruits. Zohrrab has been a client of AqroInvest since 2010. He has successfully repaid his previous 2 loans and is now requesting a third loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Zohrab has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 350 AZN a month. He is ready to give all he can in order to send all of his children to university as he dreams of a better future for them.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en: Rolanda, a proud mother of six children, is from the town of Cauayan. She is married to a farmer who has helped her to manage their family farm for two years. Rolanda is known for being a hardworking and honest person. She would like a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm business. According to her plan, this investment will increase her income. Rolanda dreams of helping her children and of renovating the family home. Even though life is difficult, she enjoys being a farmer in the Philippines.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm business

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en:
Wellington, 61 years old, is married.  He has been a successful retail shop proprietor in Mariakani for the past ten years. Wellington also sells tap water on the side to supplement his income.

Wellington is a KADET LTD customer and this marks his fourth loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase stocks of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders for his shop. Wellington will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to gradually expand his shop. He hopes to expand his retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders

loans.name: Sandra Karina
