Con el monto solicitado, 3000 soles, ella comprará productos para implementar su bodega con los artículos de consumo más solicitados como arroz, azúcar, leche , pan, huevos, condimentos, embutidos, etc. Además abastecerá su stock de bebidas con la compra de cervezas y gaseosas en mayor cantidad para que pueda seguir vendiendo.
texts.en:
45-year-old Rosamira is a very friendly and entrepreneurial woman.  She has been married for a number of years and is the mother of four children who are 26, 23, 17 and 4 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and their four children who are still dependent on her and her husband for their food and education.  Rosamira's business is selling groceries and drinks.  She owns a very busy store in her home where she sells a range of different household staples such as rice, sugar, eggs, oil, milk and drinks such as soda, juice and beer.  She has been selling drinks for 16 years but has only had her grocery store for one year.  She also occasionally sells regional meals.  She always has the support of her children in all her business activities.  They help her to serve her customers, buy her products and carry out other tasks.  What Rosamira enjoys about her work is that she is able to be with her children and is always able to take care of them and keep an eye on what they are doing.  Also, because her store is very busy, she always enjoys good sales which are reflected in her daily profits.  She hopes to continue consolidating her business and making progress in her work.

This is Rosamira's 6th loan from MFP and she is grateful to those who make it possible for her to access the loan because it will make her feel more certain about making progress in her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She feels very happy with her community bank and feels that she has their support.  Rosamira will use the 3,000 soles she has requested to buy products with which to stock her store.  She will buy the goods which are in most demand such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, condiments, sausages, etc.  She will also stock up with drinks, buying beer and sodas in greater volume so that she can continue making sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, condiments and sausages

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny Zambrano tiene 30 años estado civil casada tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela .Fanny siempre le ha gustado mucho todo lo que se trate de belleza por eso ella se inscribió en un curso donde daban clases de bellez, donde aprendió todo lo ahora sabe por eso Fanny ahora quisiera tener su propio salón de belleza . ella es muy buena pintando uñas ,tambien es muy buena estilista,cortando cabello . Con el préstamo Fanny compraría cosas como; implementos de bellezas, maquinas para cortar cabello , etc
texts.en: Fanny Zambrano, 30, and her husband have 2 children, both in school.  She has a long-standing interest in beauty care and went to school to learn everything that she needs to know to start her own beauty business.  She is a talented manicurist and can cut and style hair, as well.  Fanny is applying for a loan that she use to buy the supplies she needs--beauty products, hair-cutting implements, etc.--to open her own salon.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Janeth Huberlinda

texts.es: Janeth .tiene 52 años Cuenta que desde muy pequeño sus padres era un comerciantes .Por eso el también siguió esos pasos, actualmente ella trabaja como comerciante en las calles de Guayaquil, el anhelo de él es tener un establecimiento donde el pueda vender sus productos, tener una casa propia y un vehículo para transportar mi mercadería de ropa. Ella trabaja de 9:00am hasta las 16:00pm. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar mucha más Mercadería
texts.en: Janeth, 52, tells us that her parents made their living from buying and selling merchandise and that she has followed in their footsteps.  She operates her retail business in Guayaquil.  For the future, she wants to open a shop, buy a house of her own and buy a vehicle that she can use to transport her merchandise.  Janeth works from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  She will use this loan to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Judith Alexandra

texts.es: Judith  es costurera, tiene 43 años  de estado civil casada  tiene hijos mayores de edad.  Judith comenzó hace varios años cuando el esposo de Judith le dio un derrame en su cuerpo y no podía trabajar. De ahí ella se  vio obligada a coserle ropas a sus amigas  y a la gente del barrio   y de ahí poco a poco fue aumentado sus cliente .el deseo   y anhelo de Judith  es también confeccionar ropas a gente importante de nuestro país pero la necesidad de que su máquina está un poco vieja ella quisiera comprarse una nueva. Con el préstamo ella quisiera comprar implementos como: hilos, telas, cierres, y otra máquina de coser  etc.
texts.en: Judith is a seamstress.  She is 43 years old, married, and has two adult children.  She started working several years ago when her husband suffered a stroke and was unable to work.  Judith had to start sewing clothes for her friends and neighbors, gradually increasing her number of customers.  Her desire and wish is to also make clothes for important people in the country but her sewing machine is a little old and so she would like to buy a new one.  She would like to use her loan to buy supplies such as threads, fabric, fasteners and another sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy threads, fabric, fasteners and another sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried squid to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more toys and stickers for her shop.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 28 years old. He is married to Alice, and they have one child. He operates a motorcycle and has been in business for the past two years.

This is his first business loan from KADET LTD. He will use the amount he borrows to service his motorcycle. He hopes to cause his business to grow and to start a new business for his wife in the future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 65 years old, married to Grace and a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. He sells cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes and also does dairy farming from which he sells milk to the residents of Ndunyu Njeru.

This is his second loan term from KADET LTD. He plans to buy a dairy cow to boost his dairy business. From the anticipated income, he plans to boost his farming by buying fertilizer and seeds for planting.

In the future, Peter hopes to invest more in his farming business by planting more cash crops and supplying milk to milk processing industries in the region.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a woman of thirty years, married to Joseph and a mother of two beautiful children. She operates a grocery store in Muguga on the outskirts of Kangemi. She also keeps poultry in the same area. She has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of approximately 16,000 KES.

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. In the future she wants to have a wholesale fruit shop.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 58, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Zenaida operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it with a little profit. Her products mostly are women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Zenaida hopes to expand her business and dreams to help her grandchildren with their needs. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more corn seeds to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis sells potatoes at the marketplace in Nakuru town. He has been in the business for 10 years and it has been profitable. He is 40 years old and single. 

This is his second loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to use the loan to buy more stock of potatoes for sale. Due to the high demand for potatoes in the area, he anticipates making more income, which he will use to open a grocery store. 

He hopes to buy a pickup and supply potatoes to various customers in other places.

loans.use: To buy more stock of potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William has an electronics repair shop in Nakuru town and has run the business for five years. He is 31 years old and married to Rebecca with three children. 

This is his second loan from KADET Ltd. and he plans to buy electronic appliances and accessories for use in his business. 

He hopes to grow his business and make more income as well as opening another electronics shop in the area.

loans.use: To buy more electronic  appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more balut to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chickens for a butcher shop

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms Naseem is a 22-year-old married woman. She faced financial issues in her early married life due to her husband's insufficient income. It forced her to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. 

Some years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. She gained popularity in her community through her fine stitching. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is responsible to provide for her three children. 

She is currently in her second loan and has borrowed 25,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a better source of income.

loans.use: To buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 45 años, es una mujer honesta, alegre y muy trabajadora, vive al lado de su esposo Edinson y con sus hijos de 16 y 12 años respectivamente. Además de ellos también comparte su vivienda propia con sus padres y juntos tienen el mismo deseo de progresar y conseguir un nivel de vida mejor. El trabajo de Mónica consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir de distintas marcas, modelos y tallas para todas las edades, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, del mismo modo realiza la venta de zapatos, toda su mercadería la renueva mensualmente, se encarga de solicitarla de otra ciudad mediante el apoyo de un familiar que vive en el mismo lugar de donde recibe el envío de las prendas y los calzados. Se dedica a éste negocio desde hace 20 años, complementa ésta actividad desde hace 2 años con la venta de cosméticos femeninos como cremas, perfumes, polvos faciales y otros accesorios. Trabaja sola y afortunadamente le va bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la facilidad que tiene de conseguir nuevos clientes, su carisma y su alegría le han permitido realizar buenas ventas en corto tiempo, por lo tanto el dinero que obtiene como ganancia es generado con mayor rapidez, además le permite organizar su tiempo y realizar las labores domésticas en su hogar sin descuidar a su pequeño hijo ni a sus clientes, espera conseguir más adelante un local en el que pueda establecer una pequeña boutique para continuar progresando. Este es el crédito número 14 con MFP, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea dejar una imagen negativa en los miembros de su grupo que se caracterizan por la puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. El monto solicitado (S/. 1000), lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir, zapatos y accesorios variados.
texts.en: Monica, 45, is an honest, hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband, Edinson, and their two children who are 16- and 12-years old, respectively.  The family share their house with Monica's parents.  Monica has operated a clothing sales business for 20 years.  She sells a range of clothing pieces of various styles and sizes, for all ages and for men as well as women.  She also sells footwear.  She reviews and adjusts her inventory once a month, depending on what she expects to sell.  She counts on a relative, who lives in the town from which she receives her merchandise, to order whatever she needs for the business.  Two years ago, she added beauty products--creams, perfumes, face powder, etc.--to the range of merchandise that she sells.  She works alone and says that she is pleased with her progress.  The business suits her because she is friendly and charismatic, with an easy manner that makes it easy for her to attract new customers.  The business is profitable and she can organize her time so that she can both work and take care of her family without neglecting either.   For the future, she would like to open a shop of her own.  This will be Monica's 14th MFP loan and she says that she is grateful that this means of borrowing is accessible for businesses like hers.  She says, too, that she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time and that the trust she's gained from the other members of her community bank is important to her.  Monica will use this loan (S/.1000) to stock her business with clothes, shoes and accessories.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and the mother of five children. She has a grocery store and she says that she's been in business for 10 years so she has good knowledge of this business. 

She comments that she has established a good clientele and that it's the only grocery store in the neighborhood. It's quite a sacrifice because she must open early in the morning and close late at night. She says that she at times takes her lunch very late because of the flowing customers. 

She defines herself as a very hardworking, tenacious woman who always strives to get ahead. Through her work, Chizi has managed to make some home improvements and provide her children with the necessary schooling. 

She needs this loan to buy flour, sugar, rice, soft-drinks, dairy products, baked goods and other supplies she needs to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, rice, soft-drinks, dairy products, baked goods and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a 34-year-old married woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and a daughter. Her sons are 4 and 5 years of age while the daughter's age is 10 years. All of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband is the employ of a private firm., but his income is not sufficient to meet the household expenses.

Asia is a very hardworking and independent woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's education expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past five years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

As a member of a seven-person lending group, Asia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future. And with the profit she is planning to open a new vocational center, where she can give training to women. She will also buy more stitching machines and material for her tailoring business. She is very much thankful to BRAC and says that BRAC is working very well in the field of microfinance and the staff is very cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana, de 29 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con Denis  con quien tiene 1 hijo de 6 años a quien cría en su casa propia al lado de su pareja tratando de brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida y cubrir todas sus necesidades. La función laboral que cumple nuestra amiga Roxana consiste en la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios de uso cotidiano. Toda su mercadería es enviada en grandes paquetes desde otra ciudad. Todos los días ella va en busca de sus clientes por las calles de la ciudad, las ofrecer de casa en casa vendiendo al contado o al crédito y la cobranza lo realiza en forma diaria, semanal o quincenal. Realiza este oficio hace 3 años y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su cónyuge quien tiene un vehículo y le ayuda en el traslado de su mercadería. Se siente muy satisfecha por lo bien que le va en ésta nueva etapa. Le gusta mucho tener este trabajo porque le permite disponer de su tiempo durante las horas que no está trabajando ya que puede realizar las labores de su hogar con mucha comodidad, además a aprendido a ganarse el respeto y la confianza de los clientes en base a su buen trato y su gran sonrisa, tiene buenas ventas y como resultado de ello obtiene buenas ganancias, ahora espera seguir creciendo y más adelante  conseguir un puesto de ventas para exhibir sus productos con mayor tranquilidad. Este es el préstamo número 2 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. El monto solicitado (S/. 800), lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería conformada por ropa, zapatos y  accesorios para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Roxana, 29 years old, is a kind, good and hard-working woman. She lives together with Denis, with whom she has a 6-year-old son. She raises him in her own house, together with her partner trying to bring him the best life conditions and to cover all his needs.

Roxana's line of work is selling clothes, shoes and other accesories of daily use. All her merchandise is sent in bulk from another city. Every day, she goes around looking for customers throughout the city, she sells house by house, either in cash or on credit. She collects the money daily, weekly or fortnightly. She has been doing this for three years and sometimes she gets her spouse's support, who has a vehicle and helps her transporting the merchandise.

She feels very satisfied because she is doing very well in this first stage. She loves this job because it leaves her enough time when she is not working in order to take care of the household chores in a comfortable way. Besides, she has earned her customers' respect and confidence, through a good treatment and through her big smile. She makes good sales and as a result she obtains good profits. She hopes to keep growing and later on to get an establishment where she can display her products more calmly.

This is the second loan with MFP. She is thankful to all those who grant her the loan she requires to increase her working capital. She promises to pay the installments in time. She is happy to belong to her communal bank because they are very solildary and responsible. The amount requested (S/. 800) [800 PEN], she will invest it in buying merchandise composed of clothes, shoes and accessories to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Thérèse Mirabelle

texts.fr: Thérèse est une  femme mariée mère de trois enfants qui vit dans un quartier de la capiltale. Elle détient un hangard depuis neuf ans où elle vend plusieurs produits. Grâce à son dynamisme elle s'est vite faite une clientèle qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle sollicite un prêt qui lui permettra d'acheter un sac d'arachides, un sac de mais et un sac de macabos. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront d'augmenter son capital et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thérèse is a married mother of three children living in a district of the capital. She got a stall nine years ago where she sells many products. Her enthusiasm has helped her to build a customer base whose needs she hopes to continue to meet. 

To that end, she is seeking a loan to buy one bag of groundnuts, one bag of maize, and one bag of macabo tubers. The profits earned through this new credit will allow her to bolster her working capital and to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy one bag of groundnuts, one bag of maize, and one bag of macabo tubers.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 38 years old from Olkalou and married with four children who are between 9 years and 3 years old. 

Philip has a cereals shop that he has been running for the past four years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy maize, beans, green grams, etc., to add to his stock for sale.

He hopes to enlarge his cereals shop in the near future and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and green grams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Savet is married and a mother of three children who are students in the local public school. Her entire family is residing in Dambae district, Cambodia.

To sustain her family, she has been growing cassava on a one-hectare area and planting rice on another one-hectare of farmland. As her husband's health condition is not so good, her business depends on her. For the nine years that she has engaged in this business, she has earned about 25,000 KHR per day. 

She is a second-time borrower with Kiva's partner,VisionFund. From her past loan, which she has paid back with success, she can manage her cash-crop progressively especially in paying for the labor cost. Now, she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. She is going to use this loan to pay for weeding fees and labor fees to transplant her rice seedlings. She hopes that this loan will return her good output, so she can keep supporting her children in school and maintaining her living condition.

loans.use: To pay for transplanting and weeding fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from AVON to resell.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
A farmer originally from Dambae district (Cambodia), Sun is 59 years old and married. He has six children, two of whom are in school and some are helping the family business. 

His two and half hectares of cassava-growing farmland and two hectares of rice-cropping farmland are the only business that he has been with for 30 years as the main source of income for his household. 

This is his third-cycle microloan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). He has succeeded in managing his business with a good pace. As a result, he is applying for this new loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR to keep supporting his business by purchasing insecticide for his cassava field. Another portion of it will be used to pay for transplanting fees. He expects to a gain high yield and upgrade his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy insecticide for the cassava field and pay transplanting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanely's business is doing great, and he still sells green peas in an open air market in Nakuru town.

This is his second loan from KADET Ltd. after he was introduced by a KADET client. He serviced his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the new loan amount to purchase more peas for resale in his business so that he can meet the demand of his customers.

He plans to purchase a truck to assist him in transporting the peas from farms.

loans.use: Purchase stock of green peas from farmers for sale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es muy emprendedor y también siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy luchador en la vida. Hace muchos años generaba sus ingresos trabajando como conductor de un camión, pero como esto no era suficiente para sostener su familia un día decidió emprender y montar un negocio de lo que el quería. Fue así como inició con un puesto de venta de comidas rápidas, cocinando en un carrito y ubicado a las afueras de su casa; gracias a su esfuerzo con extensas jornadas de trabajo a los 3 meses se pudo ubicar en un local del sector y desde allí pudo tener una mejor atención para los clientes gracias a que contaba con mejores equipos para la preparación de las comidas. Como le estaba yendo tan bien, se tuvo que trasladar hacia otro local y ahora desde allí está trabajando fuertemente para seguir saliendo adelante con su negocio y continuar generando los ingresos con los cuales ofrece a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Para poder cumplir con un requerimiento de las autoridades de sanidad, Mario busca un préstamo para comprar una campana extractora de olores, y construir el túnel de evacuación.

Su sueño es poder mejorar cada vez más con este negocio y ahorrar el dinero que necesita para comprarse una casa propia donde pueda ofrecerle a su familia un hogar más estable.
texts.en:
Mario is very entrepreneurial and also always has been characterized for being a fighter in life. Many years ago he used to generate earnings as a truck driver but this was not enough to sustain his family. Because of this, one day he decided to start up a business that he wanted. It was in this way that he began his food stall, cooking in a vehicle located outside his house. Thanks to his efforts and extensive hours working after three months he has been able to locate his stall in a locale of the area and from there offer better service to his customers since he now has better equipment to prepare his food.

As everything was going well for him, he has to move to a new locale and now is there working hard to continue moving his business forward and continue generating earnings to offer his family a good quality life. In order to be able to fulfill a requirement from the health authority, Mario is seeking a loan to buy a range hood and ventilation duct. 

His dream is to be able to improve his business more everyday and save money that he needs to buy his own house where he could offer his family a more stable home.

loans.use: to buy a range hood and ventilation duct.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica de 28 años está casada con Nilson con quien tiene 4 hijos de 12, 8, 5 y 2 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo agrícola. Yessica es una madre muy cariñosa. Todo su esfuerzo en el trabajo lo realiza por el amor a sus hijos. Ella es agricultura desde los 16 años. Al lado de Nilson han logrado sacar adelante a su familia. En todo este tiempo laborando en el campo, ha conseguido satisfacciones como adquirir sus terrenos propios, construir su casa, educar a sus hijos y ahorrar.
En esos terrenos cultiva papas de variedades “Yungay”, “Canchán” y “Única”. “Estas papas se venden más y sus precios son más caros, cada kilo llega a costar a 1 sol”, dice orgullosa.
Pero como las cosechas son productivas, la inversión también es cuantiosa. Ella destina dinero para las semillas, el fertilizante, el pago de personal, y otros.
Por eso, esta vez, Yessica requiere de su apoyo para continuar con sus planes y adquirir varias bolsas de abonos orgánicos. Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP. Se siente respaldada por el apoyo de la entidad en todo este tiempo y porque le permitió crecer como negociante. Pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Cayán”, y le agrada el trabajo con sus socios por ser muy carismáticos.
Con los 2500 soles solicitados podrá adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos para sus cultivos de papas “Yungay”.
texts.en:
Yessica, age 28, is married to Nilson. They have four children ages 18, 8, 5 and 2. They live in their own home located in an agricultural annex.Yessica is a very affectionate mother. She does all of her hard work out of love for her children. She has been a farmer for 16 years. Side by side, she and Nilson have been able to get their family ahead. During all of this time working in the field, she has had many satisfactions. These include acquiring her own land, building her home, educating her children, and saving money.
She cultivates the “Yungay”, “Canchán” and “Única” varieties of potato. "These potatoes are the ones that sell the most and at the best prices. Every kilo can cost 1 sol", she says proudly. 
However, just as the harvests are high, so too is the investment. She spends money on seeds, fertilizer, labour, and other costs.
So, for these costs, Yessica now needs your support in order to continue with her plans and acquire several bags of organic fertilizer. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She feels that she has been supported by the microfinance company for all this time, because it has allowed her to grow as a businessperson. She belongs to the “Progreso Cayán” communal bank, and she enjoys working with her fellow members because they are very charismatic.
With the requested 2500 soles, she will be able to acquire bags of organic fertilizer for her Yungay potato crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer for her "Yungay" potato crops.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus, age 50, lives with her life companion and her six children. She buys and sells women’s and men’s clothes. She has a variety of shirts, pants, dresses, blouses, and more. She has had her business for over 10 years, and this has gifted her with a lot of sales experience. This allows her to get very good income.

She sells in a very strategic place at a market that is very busy. She has obtained a lot of clientele. They prefer her because she always has what they need, a quality product at a reasonable price. She also provides excellent service.

Dorcus is an enterprising woman who is devoted to her work. She gets up every day with the inclination to strive for a more prosperous future. She knows that it is only this way that she will be successful.

In the past weeks demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of this by making a new investment. That is why she is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy bales of clothes wholesale. She affirms that she will be able to repay the loan and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
Yun is 62 years old and married. Her household consists of 12 persons including her ten children, but only one of them depends on her and is helping the family business. Her source of income is mainly from her rice cultivation and additional income is from fish-catching. She has engaged in these businesses for 23 years and is able to earn almost 14,000 KHR per day.

This is her first loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. In a group of two female members, she is the group leader. Both of them are in the same cycle, first cycle, but they are seeking different loan amounts. Yun is seeking 300,000 KHR and her fellow group member is applying for 160,000 KHR. Yun will use her portion to buy materials for building a decent latrine for the family's use. She hopes to have a decent latrine in order to improve her family's hygienic practices.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a latrine

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
Seak is a rural villager from Pouk district, Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are students. For daily decent food and other basic needs, she grows paddy, sells Khmer noodle, and raises pigs.  She has been with these businesses for 10 years. 

Seak and her co-members, in a group of three females, have never joined VisionFund before and she is the group leader. All of them are seeking the same loan amount, 1,000,000 KHR each. Seak is going to spend her portion on buying fertilizer for her rice-farm. She hopes to receive high yield and make more profit, so she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice farm

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 6 filhos, 2 ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ela.
É agente de saúde e funcionária do Ministério da Saúde. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento cola, tijoleiras, loiça da cozinha e outros) para continuar apetrechando a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja construir uma casa de banho muito melhorado e continuar apostando no futuro dos filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para poder responder os seus projectos futuros.
texts.en:
Louise is single and the mother of 6 children, 2 of whom still attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and supports 1 nephew who lives with her. 

She is a health agent and an employee of the Ministry of Health. With the current loan, she intends to purchase construction materials (cement, glue, bricks, kitchen crockery and others) to continue to fit out her home.

In future she wishes to build an improved bathroom and continue to invest in her children's future. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of funds in order to carry out her future projects.

loans.use: pretende comprar material de construção (cimento cola, tijoleiras, loiça da cozinha e outros)

loans.name: Haider

texts.en:
Haider is 38-year-old man. He is living in Punjab, Pakistan. He has two sons who are studying in 4th and 7th class, while his wife stays at home and looks after her children and other household activities. 

For seven years, Haider has been operating his own garment shop, which is the only source of income for the family. As Eid-ul-Azah is near, he wants to increase his clients on this special occasion by offering a variety of products to them. For that he has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase new garments for his shop. With the profit he is planning to open a new garment shop so that he could generate more income in the future. Greetings for Kiva and BRAC from him.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for his garment shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his pedicab.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
A 44-year-old married mother residing in Kampong Cham province's Me Mot district, Ra is a farmer who has tried her best to keep supporting her family, especially her children. She has six children, five of whom are students. The remaining one is helping the family's business. 

Her one hectare of farmland for growing cassava and another hectare for growing rice, which she has been working for 10 years, has return her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Ra's group consists of two female members. She and her co-member are in the same loan cycle and seeking the same loan amount: first-loan cycle and 500,000 KHR each. 

As the group leader, she will use her portion to pay for the weeding fee for her cassava and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to grow her cash crop timely and improve her living condition.

loans.use: To pay for weeding fees and to buy pesticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Saroun's Group

texts.en:
Saroun, aged 44 and a mother of three children, is a farmer from Siem Reap province, Kror Lanh. She grows rice on her three hectares of farmland and her husband catches fish to sell for this household's sake. Having been with this business for 10 years, she can earn about 25,000 KHR per day. This is her fourth-cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) and first-cycle loan for her co-member; there are two female members in her group. 

After the successful loan that she has paid back, she feels empowered to maintain her living conditions better than before. Now, she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while her fellow group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Saroun is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes this purchase will increase her production and return a high profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Ms. Nasira is 22 years old, a dynamic, single woman. She has a boutique business for the past 3 years. She is fervent about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Nasira’s embroidery model is very popular on her street and local market and she is the best earning resource in her household. She herself makes the clothing and her brother is supporting her in marketing and selling. 

Nasira wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy raw materials such as cloth  and reels of thread in different colors. According to Nasira, she faced many problems during operating her domestic system. Her brother was a laborer. He was not able to cover the expenses for the family alone. Nasira took the initiative to start her business with some savings. At this time, she is very much satisfied and thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as cloth  and reels of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Cheoun's Group

texts.en:
Cheoun, 47, is a citizen residing in a rural area of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has nine children. Five of her children -- one daughter and four sons -- are school-aged children and still dependent on her. The other four (sons) are working for others as paid workers. 

To cover her daily expenses and meet the needs of the family, she farms rice and grows sesame, the businesses in which she has been involved for 15 years. Cheoun has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already, with which she succeeded in better supporting the living standards of her family. 

Now Cheoun together with her fellow group member, Mom, are requesting a loan in the amount of 2,200,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) in total. Cheoun will spend her requested loan portion, which is 1,200,000 KHR, on purchasing fertilizers, pesticide and gasoline. This loan portion will allow her to harvest good quality yields so that she can sell at very good prices to boost her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide and gasoline for producing rice and sesame.

loans.name: Phobe

texts.en:
Phobe is a woman passionate about her work, as she has been selling food in a food stall for eight years. She is grateful to God and also to the microfinance institution as she strives to meet her goals.

At the moment, her concern is to keep reinvesting in her business, with the aim of offering her customers a more varied menu and increasing her earnings. In this way she will achieve a greater degree of customer loyalty and stability in the market to which she is directing her efforts.

For this reason, she will need to undertake the purchase of basic staples such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, flour, corn and other products.

In the future, she hopes to have the financial resources to expand her business to a hotel (a small restaurant).

loans.use: to purchase basic staples such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, flour, corn and other products.

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Saem is 31 years old and a villager in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three children (one daughter and two sons), all of whom are dependent on her and currently in school. To earn a living for her family, Saem has been involving in a rice-farming business and a pig-raising business for ten years. These businesses enable her to earn approximately 19,000 KHR per day but, after deducting daily expenses, she can save only around 6,000KHR. 

This will be Saem’s fifth time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loans have helped her to sustain her crop and household. Now Saem is leading a group member named Rim, who has only been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, to request a loan in the amount of 1,350,000 KHR in total. Saem plans on using her requested loan portion, which is 1,100,000KHR, to buy fertilizers so that she can smoothly support her rice field and to buy building materials to fix her house. After wisely using her loan portion, she believes that her businesses will provide good outcome so that she can gain more profit to better support the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and materials to fix her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Olivia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, 3 ainda frequentam Escola no nível Secundário, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante e dona do seu próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, bolachas, sardinhas, doces, açúcar e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja reabilitar a sua casa e ampliar o seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é redobrar os esforços para poder liquidar o empréstimo o mais rápido possível.
texts.en:
Olivia is married and the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom still attend high School, lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She is a trader and owns her own business selling various products. With the present loan she intends to buy products (refreshments, biscuits, sardines, sweets, sugar and others) to increase the quantity of her goods.

In future, she wishes to rehabilitate her house and expand her business. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to double her efforts in order to be able to pay off her loan as quickly as possible.

loans.use: buy products (refreshments, biscuits, sardines, sweets, sugar and others)

loans.name: Valentin Luc

texts.fr: Valentin est un monsieur âgé de 40 ans qui vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Il tient un comptoir depuis 10 ans où il vend des manuels scolaires. Du fait de son dynamisme il s'est fait une large clientèle dont il aimerait toujours assurer la satisfaction. Pour cela, il sollicite un prêt qui lui permettra d'acheter des livres du secondaire et des  fascicules. Les bénéfices tirés de cet emprunt lui permettront non seulement d'améliorer son activité mais aussi  de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Valentin is a 40-year-old man who lives in an area around the capital. He has had a counter for 10 years where he sells textbooks. 

Because of his energy, he has attracted a large amount of customers. He would like to always ensure their satisfaction.

For this, Valentin is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy secondary school books and booklets. The profits made from this loan will allow him to not only improve his business but also support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy secondary school books and booklets

loans.name: Njiwa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sifa , leader du groupe d’affaire « Njiwa », est entrepreneur courageuse, âgée d’environ 34 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse des souliers. Son mari est aussi petit commerçant de divers. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché de CADECO- Ville. Il y a plus de 9 ans, elle exerce cette petite activité génératrice de revenus. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 20 cycles au sein du projet de microcrédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 15 pairs de souliers à marchander. En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle qu’elle offrira à ses propre parents en guise de cadeau. La cliente salut l'initiative de Hekima pour en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
Sifa is a brave entrepreneur, and the leader of the business group « Njiwa ». She is a 34-year-old married mother of seven children who all go to school. 

Sifa sells shoes, and her husband also works in small trade selling various products. She displays her merchandise at the market of CADECO-Ville. She has been in this line of work for over nine years. 

Sifa has completed 20 loans cycles with Hekima’s microfinance program. This new loan will help her to buy 15 pairs of shoes for resale. She wants to provide for her children’s education, and she would also like to purchase a plot of land to give to her parents. 

Sifa wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping impoverished women who cannot use traditional banking channels.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
A 34-year-old married woman, Oun is a citizen in a rural area of Kampong Cham’s Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. She is married and has three lovely sons who are all school-aged children and still dependent on her. 

She earns her living through farming rice and growing vegetables (cabbages and cucumbers). Having been in the current businesses for many years, Oun earns around 28,000 KHR per day and is able to set approximately 10,000 KHR aside for future needs. 

Due to the low yields being destroyed by insects and the lack of water, Oun is leading a group of two female members who are both first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Oun will spend this very first requested loan portion on buying fertilizers, insecticide, and seeds (cabbage seeds and cucumber seeds). 

She highly hopes that, after receiving her loan portion, the living condition of her family will be better and her three beloved sons can have as high as possible in terms of education. With this loan portion, she also plans on expanding her vegetable-growing business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chhunleng's Group

texts.en:
Chhunleng, 44 years old, is married and has two schoolchildren. 

She overcomes her family's hardship through farming rice and working as a paid worker. She is able to earn about 9,500 KHR per day from the current business, which she has experienced for 20 years. 

Her first loan with VisionFund was two cycles ago. She has smartly used her past two loans with success to better support her business and her household, mainly for her children's education. 

Now, in a group of two female members, one of whom is a newly joined client with VisionFund, Chhunleng is the group leader. The total loan of her group is 1,500,000 KHR. 

She will use her portion (500,000 KHR) to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to cover her children's education. She hopes that this purchase will boost her yield and make it become more profitable so she can keep up a good living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and cover her children's education fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
A 62-year-old father of six children, Sorn and family are residing in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. One (son) of his children is employed as a mobile phones repairer. 

Sorn has 37 years of experience in his current businesses, a rice-growing business and pig-raising business. Sorn earns approximately 22,000 KHR per day and manages to save only 16,000 after offsetting the daily cost of living. His day-to-day livelihood has struggled a bit, since he is in need of money to support his children’s schooling in Phnom Penh (capital city of Cambodia). 

He is leading a group of two to apply for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Sorn will spend his loan portion on buying fertilizers to apply to his farmland and buying pig feed to feed his pigs so that they will be fatter and healthier. 

Via the efficient usage of this loan portion, Sorn believes that he will be able to boost his income and set aside some money for covering the needs of the family, especially the fees of his children’s schooling. In the future, he also hopes to operate a new business, which is a sugarcane-growing business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Nan is a 37-year-old father of six children. All of his children, three daughters and three sons, are students and still dependent on him. He provides financial means to his family through growing cassava on a three-hectare farmland. Having been in this business for ten years, Nan earns around 33,000 KHR per day and saves approximately 11,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

Nan, a second-time borrower, is leading a group member who is just a first-time borrower with VisionFund to seek a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. The first loan that Nan raised via VisionFund helped him relieve his family’s burden. Now with his newly requested loan portion, he plans on utilizing some portion of it to buy fertilizers and pesticide to help keep his cassava field. Some other portion of the loan will be spent on covering the fees of labor. He hopes that his income will be greater after efficiently using his requested loan portion so that he will be able to educate his children by sending them to good schools.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for cassava field

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is 34 years of age and lives with her husband, who is dedicated to household matters, and their five children. Mnyazi is quite a visionary young woman who wants to get ahead and have a better life. She operates a poultry business selling both eggs and chickens for slaughter.

Mnyazi is requesting a loan to allow her to increase the quantity of chickens and to buy feed for her chickens. She wants to greatly expand her business, and she puts much effort into this goal. At her young age, she has demonstrated herself to be a very enterprising person with much desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of chickens and to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a passionate woman and doing a business of used and new cloth sales from the last four years. She has been working night and day to fulfill the basic necessities of her family.  Her collection is very famous in her town. She offers a variety of cloth in different colors to her customers and makes enough money to lead a decent life. Her husband is in the business of selling ice creams door to door and earns too little income to support his family alone. Her two sons also work on a cloth shop but earn a small income. 

Rukhsana is a loving mother of one daughter and two sons. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 50,000/- to buy a stock of more cloth of different colors in various designs. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of more cloth of different colors in various designs.

loans.name: Suraya's Group

texts.en:
Suraya is a 54-year-old housewife. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, three daughters and two sons. Two of her sons are doing jobs, one daughter is married and the second one is a student. 

Since 2002, her husband has been running a general store and tiles shop. He works very hard to meet his family's needs. But for the last few months he hasn't been able to generate sufficient income from his general store business, so he wants to purchase some more materials like a photostat machine, paper reams, books, etc. It will greatly help him to generate a good income.

Suraya, as a member of a 10-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for that purpose. With the loan amount, her husband will purchase variety of goods for his general store to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children. With the profit he will invest some amount in his tiles shop as well.

Suraya's husband is too old now, so she wants her sons to help their father in the business. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for them. She is very much thankful to Kiva.

Note: In the picture, Suraya is the one holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase material like a photostat machine, paper reams and books for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ms. Ameera is a 52-year-old active woman. She has been in the business of flower making for many years. She makes different colors of paper flowers and offers them for special occasions. She is in much demand in her community. People buy beautiful flowers from her and use them in decorating their events.  

She is a motivated mother of three children and is responsible for providing them with good quality food, clothing and education. She requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs) to buy papers of different types and various colors. This will help in catering to more customers. She intends to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To buy papers of different types and various colors to make flowers.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms. Bushra is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of sewing in her community for the last ten years. She fulfills the demands and standards of customers. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is a rickshaw (auto) driver and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of four children and one of her children is deaf and mute. She needs to earn more for the treatment of her child, so she is working hard to contribute to the family income. She is very motivated to provide for her family. 

To earn enough, she requires investing in her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy reels of threads, buttons, and zips in different colors from the market at lower rates. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with the expenses of the medical treatment for her child.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads, buttons, and zips in different colors from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique est une  femme de 38 ans, mariée, mère de famille. Elle a un atelier de couture qu'elle gère depuis 12 ans déjà dans un quartier de la capitale.Elle a une bonne clientèle mais se retrouve tout le temps en rupture de matériel parce qu'elle achète en petite quantité pour confectionner les vêtements qu'elle vend. Ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter en grande quantité son matériel de couture(accessoires, tissus) ce qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs, satisfaire sa clientèle et réaliser un bon profit. Ce bénéfice lui permettra non seulement de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille, mais aussi d'agrandir son activité avec le temps en achetant en grande quantité.
texts.en:
Monique is a 38-year-old married mother.

She has a sewing workshop that she has been running for 12 years now in a neighborhood of the capital city. She has many customers but is always running out of material because she buys her clothes-making materials in small quantity. This loan will allow her to buy her sewing materials (accessories, fabric) in bulk, which will enable her to meet her goals, satisfy her customers, and make a good profit.

The loan will not only allow her to provide for her own everyday needs and the everyday needs of her family, but it will also allow her to expand her business over time by buying her materials in bulk.

loans.use: to buy fabric and accessories in bulk

loans.name: Jhenny

texts.es:
Jhenny de 23 años convive con Jesús con quien tiene 1 hijo de 2 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia que hace poco terminar de construir y se ubica en un distrito agrícola. Jhenny es una mujer agricultora. A su corta edad posee una fuerza incomparable para trabajar en el campo. Ella misma voltea la tierra, siembra, cultiva y cosecha sus productos. Su esposo realiza la misma actividad. Ambos trabajan arduamente para lograr el crecimiento de su familia. 
Las papas en algunas de sus variedades, son su principal producto de cultivo, y ya conocen compradores fijos, quienes no dudan en adquirir las cosechas de Jhenny.
Este mes la mayoría de los agricultores están sembrando, y ella no se quedará atrás. Iniciará una siembra de papas de la variedad “Canchán” por ello requiere de su ayuda, para adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes. Éste es su tercer crédito con MFP. Se compromete en pagar las cuotas con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Cayán”, y se siente cómoda trabajando con socios alegres y responsables.
Con los 1000 soles podrá adquirir 10 bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos, para esparcirlos en sus sembríos de papas.
texts.en:
Jhenny, age 23, lives with Jesús; they have one two-year-old child. They live in their own home, which they recently finished building, located in an agricultural district. Jhenny is a farmer. At her young age she has an incomparable strength for working in the fields. She tills the ground, plants the seeds, tends the crops and harvests her produce, all herself. She and Jesús work hard for the health of their family. Her main product is potatoes, which she grows in several varieties. She has fixed buyers who never hesitate to buy her produce.
This month, the majority of the farmers are planting, and she does not want to fall behind. She will begin sowing a crop of “Canchán” potatoes, and she needs your help to buy bags of fertilizer. This is her third loan with MFP. She promises to repay her quotas punctually. She belongs to the “Progreso Cayán” communal bank. She feels comfortable working with the happy, responsible bank members.
With these 1000 soles, she will be able to acquire 10 bags of organic fertilizer for her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 1 filha, ainda menor de idade para frequentar Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É enfermeira do Ministerio da Saude afecta no centro de saúde local. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, ferro, chapas de zinco, cimento e outros) para reabilitar e ampliar a sua casa. 
No futuro pretende construir uma outra casa no segundo terreno que possui, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais ainda e melhorar e solicitar mais empréstimos para atingir seus objectivos.
texts.en:
Victoria is married and the mother of 1 daughter who is still too young to attend School, lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a nurse with the Ministry of Health and a permanent employee at her local health centre. With the current loan she intends to buy construction materials (beams, iron, zinc sheets, cement and others) to rehabilitate and expand her house.

In future she plans to build another house on the second piece of land she owns and to this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work even more and improve in order to solicit further loans to reach her objectives.

loans.use: buy construction materials (beams, iron, zinc sheets, cement and others) to rehabilitate and expand her house

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Ream is a 35-year-old rice farmer who lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. Besides rice farming, Ream’s husband also complements the income by catching fish. Having been in this occupation for five years, they are able to earn almost 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Insufficient working capital to support the paddy-field is still the main challenge.

Ream has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and fully paid back the past loans. She has wisely used the previous loans to better support her family's living conditions. She is asking for another loan with VisionFund of 1,600,000 KHR. She is going to utilize her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 33 years old and from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 3-12. She is a farmer who grows rice for a living. She works hard on her farm so she can provide for her children and help her husband who is a habal-habal (a motorcycle used to transport passengers in remote towns and places) driver.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for the labor of the hired help who will be helping in the land preparation. In the future she hopes for her children to succeed through education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчера женщина в возрасте 45, у нее 3 детей. Одну из дочерей они выдают замуж . Для этого они с мужем должны провести свадьбу и несколько мероприятий . Гулчехра работает продавцом в магазине и поваром  по совместительству в этом же магазине. Все что она зарабатывает уходит только на семейные нужды. Для проведения свадьбы у ни не хватает денег, для этого она обратилась в Арванд за помощью и поддержкой.
Муж Гулчехры работает в России. Сейчас он приехал чтобы  провести свадьбу дочери.  Но через некоторое время он опять уедет что бы продолжить работу в России. Очень надеются на поддержку с Арванд, так как не имеют другого выхода.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is 45 years old and has 3 children. One of her daughters is getting married soon, and this involves Gulchehra and her husband hosting the wedding and several other social gatherings. Gulchehra works in a store both as a salesclerk and as a part-time cook . All of her earnings go towards paying for the family's needs. There is not enough money to cover the wedding expenses, and for this reason she has approached Arvand for help and support.

Gulchehra's husband works in Russia. He has come home to host his daughter's wedding, but will soon have to return to Russia to continue working. Gulchehra and her husband are really hoping for support from Arvand because they have no other option.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Chanthoun

texts.en:
Chanthoun, 46, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four children, three of whom are dependent on her and they are in school. Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income, which she has been in for five years. To add up more income for the family, she also sells rice-soup in the local area. The current business earns her approximately 27,000 KHR per day and allows her to save about 10,000 KHR  each day after daily expenses. 

Chanthoun has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which has improved her family's livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to utilize this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Chanthoun hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice fruitfully and timely so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a warm cover for her 'ger' (traditional yurt)

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 29 years old. He is accompanied by Agnes and they have two children. Both are still young. He is in sales. He has a small grocery store which is well stocked. It's been about three years since he got into this business, so he has a good customer base and a little experience in the industry. He started with capital that he had saved through farming, and at the first opportunity he opened his business with his wife. 

He's requesting this loan to buy basic necessity items to stock his store such as foodstuffs, drinks and dairy products, among other things. He appreciates the confidence and opportunity to get ahead that he's received and he says that he won't disappoint.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity items to stock his store such as foodstuffs, drinks and dairy products, among other things

loans.name: Janit

texts.en:
Janit is 26 years old. She is a young mother of a 4-year-old girl. She is married and lives with her family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. Janit has grown rice for a living for 2 years now. This is how she helps her husband, who works as a sewer.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for the labor of men who will be helping in the planting season. This way she will be able to focus on working as these inputs are already prepared. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to have other business options for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо  торгует на рынке почти 15 лет мужской, верхней одеждой.  У неё торговая точка в многолюдном месте в центральном вещевом рынке.  У неё большой стаж работы и кредитования в нашей организации.  С нами работает с 2006го года.  Непрерывно получает кредит, начинала с маленького размера,так как у неё был небольшой оборот.  Постепенно использовав кредит, она увеличила ассортимент товара и расширилась. Всегда  очень удачно использовала все кредиты,что доказывает её товарооборот.  Сейчас она получает только большие суммы, она ездит за товаром в дальние регионы.  На полученный кредит закупить мужскую одежду. Точинисо намерена не переставая сотрудничать с Арванд и благодарна нам за  помощь.
texts.en:
For almost 15 years, Tojiniso has been selling men's outerwear in the market. She has a shop in a crowded area in the central clothing market. 

She has great experience in work and in borrowing from our organization. She has been working with us since 2006. She has been continuously receiving loans, starting with a small amount, since for her it was a minor revolution. 

Gradually by using credit, she has increased the range of products and expanded her business. She has always very successfully used all the loans, which improves her turnover. Now, she is getting large amounts. She travels to remote regions to use the loan to buy men's clothing. 

Tojiniso intends without ceasing to work with Arvand and is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing

loans.name: Altantuul

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantuul is 38 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in an apartment in Niseh district, Mongolia. Her husband, Bold-Erdene, is 38 years old. His profession is a welder. Her three children, Bat-Orgil, Dulguunmurun and Narmandah, are secondary school students.  

Mrs. Altantuul has worked as a knitter in a cashmere company for 8 years. She has excellent experience in this industry. She is planning to start her own knitwear business. She is an honest and open-minded person. She needs 3,500,000 MNT to buy equipment for her business.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives with her husband and their five children in her own house. She sells fruits and vegetables like bananas, potatoes, onions and tomatoes, among others, in the local market where she lives. She has a large, regular clientele that prefers to buy from her because she always has what they need at affordable prices and in addition her service is unequaled. She is always at their disposal when they visit her. Other sources of income come from farming; she grows a variety of crops including corn.

Florence is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead and is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will help her reach success. She works day to day with much enthusiasm to reach it. She wants to expand her business and to do so she needs to invest which is why she’s asking Yehu for a loan to buy potatoes, onions, kale, cabbages, tomatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, kale, cabbages, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Maisakeena

texts.en:
Maisakeena is 56-year-old married woman. She has been running a small general store with her husband for many years. The man shown in the photo is Maisakeena’s husband. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of three children. She is responsible for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. 

Her husband assists in buying stock of goods from the market. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. Then she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to improve her home conditions and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 32 años. Estudió psicología en la Universidad del Valle en Cali-Colombia, gracias al apoyo incondicional de su madre y hermanos. Debido a su excelente desempeño académico fue beneficiaria del estímulo económico que ofrece la Universidad para el pago de matricula durante toda su formación, lo que representó un alivio no sólo para ella sino para su familia, cuyos recursos económicos provienen de la confección de ropa.

Angélica desea continuar su formación académica realizando una maestría en L’ecole des hautes etudes en Francia. Por lo anterior solicita el apoyo de Kiva para concretar su proceso de postulación a la Universidad con lo siguiente: traducción y legalización de documentos oficiales, gastos de movilidad para entrevistas de selección, así como los costos de matrícula.

Aquí está su historia:

A la edad de siete años descubrí el impacto que me generaba el trabajo con los niños que cuidaba mi madre cuando vivíamos en Venezuela. Esto despertó en mí el deseo de conocer la manera cómo crecen, se desarrollan y sobre todo la forma como inciden en ellos las dinámicas familiares, sociales y culturales. Por consiguiente, decidí estudiar psicología. No obstante, debí esperar y trabajar durante cinco años para reunir las condiciones económicas que me permitieran ingresar a la universidad pública. Una vez allí logré darle sentido a muchos de mis interrogantes y mayor complejidad también.

Después de dos años de experiencia como psicóloga en una institución de protección a niños y niñas cuyos derechos han sido vulnerados, nuevamente he sentido el mismo impacto. Sobre todo por las maneras tan diversas como ellos asumen la vulneración o amenaza de sus derechos. Precisamente deseo conocer, en el marco de mi tesis de maestría, la manera cómo los han aprehendido y cómo esto incide en la forma de asumir la vulneración y amenaza. A partir de lo anterior, me propongo el diseño de una estrategia de formación en derechos desde el grado de transición hasta el quinto de primaria.

Finalmente, ése impacto que nació en mí durante la niñez y que me acompañó en la Universidad, se ha convertido en un imperativo social de bienestar y justicia hacia la niñez. Imperativo que requiere la unión de esfuerzos y la puesta en marcha de una red de trabajo a la que me adscribo, e invito a Kiva a que se una a esta causa pues su apoyo representa un motor de arranque para este objetivo.
texts.en:
Angelica, 32, studied psychology at Valle University in Cali, Colombia and says that she was able to finish her degree thanks to the unconditional support of her mother, brothers and sisters.  She had an excellent academic record at the university and received a stipend that covered the cost of her tuition there.  The stipend was a big help for her family, who operate a clothing sales business, as well as for her.

Angelica now wants to study for a masters degree at the L'Ecole des Hautes Etudes in France.  She is applying to Kiva lenders for a loan that she will use to cover the costs of translating and processing official documents, related travel expenses, and tuition fees.  

Here is her story:

I knew from the time that I was seven years old that I wanted to work with children.  We were living in Venezuela then and my mother was caring for children there.  I wanted to understand how children developed and, above all, the way that family, social and cultural dynamics shape children.  That urge I felt led me to study psychology, but I had to wait five years before I could start at the university because I had to work and pull enough money together to pay the related costs.  Once there, I was able to make sense of the many questions that I had and work through the complexities they entailed.

After two year as a psychologist at an institution for the protection of children whose rights had been violated, I knew that I wanted to learn more.  I was struck by the many, many ways that the rights of children are violated and threatened.  Specifically, I wanted to understand--to put it in the context of my planned masters thesis--the process for arresting children and the ways that the process relates to violations and threats to children's rights.

This urge, then, awakened first in my childhood and still strong through my years at the university, has become a social imperative for children's rights and well-being.  An imperative that requires a joint effort and the advancement of the work to which I have dedicated myself.  I hope Kiva lenders will join the cause because your support represents the engine that will drive us to the goal.

loans.use: to study for a career as an advocate for children's rights.

loans.name: Tuyana

texts.ru: Туяна - предприниматель из Бердянска. Ее торговая точка расположена на центральном рынке, где Туяна торгует женской одеждой: носки, чулки, кофты, футболки, колготы. Этот кредит ей понадобился для закупки осеннего товара, теплых носков, колгот, а так же осенних кофт. Туяна - клиент порядочный и всегда во время осуществляет свои выплаты.
texts.en: Tuyana is an entrepreneur from Berdyansk. Her shop is located in the central market, where Tuyana sells women's clothing: socks, stockings, sweaters, shirts, and tights. She needs this loan to buy fall goods: warm socks, tights, as well as fall jackets. Tuyana as a customer is always honest and pays her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy warm socks, tights, and jackets.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny de 27 años está casada con Juan con quien tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo rural. Yenny es una mujer capaz. Desde los 17 años ya trabajaba en el campo con sus padres, por ello se autocalifica como una buena agricultora. Posee terrenos propios que sus padres le heredaron, además arrienda otros. En dichas parcelas produce solo papas pero en variedades. Se siente satisfecha con su trabajo,  porque negocia sus productos de tal manera que le permitan volver a invertir en otras siembras y conseguir ahorros. “Lo más cansado del trabajo es llevar las cosechas hasta la ciudad para venderlos, cuando pasa esto contratamos camiones”, dice.
El mes pasado ya sembró como 15 sacos de semillas de papas, por eso solicita un crédito, para adquirir fertilizantes orgánicos que le permitan  obtener mejores resultados. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP. Se siente agradecida por la confianza en los ciclos anteriores. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Su banco comunal se llama “Progreso Cayán” y le gusta el trabajo en equipo.
Con los 2000 soles solicitados podrá adquirir varias bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Yenny, 27, is married to Juan with whom she has two children, ages 8 and 11.  They live in their own home located in a rural annex.  Yenny is a capable woman.  Since she was 17 she worked in the fields with her parents and for this reason she describes herself as a good farmer.  She has her own land that she inherited from her parents, in addition to renting other land.  In these plots she only produces potatoes but in a variety.  She is satisfied with her work because she negotiates her products in such a way that they allow her to return to invest in other plants and to continue saving.  "The most tiring part of the job is taking the harvests to the city in order to sell them, when this happens we rent trucks," she says.

Last month she already planted about 15 sacks of potato seed which is why she asks for a loan in order to acquire organic fertilizer that would allow them to get better results.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the trust during the previous cycles.  She gives her word to be punctual with her repayments.  Her communal bank is called "Progreso Cayán" and she likes working as a team.  With the requested 2000 soles she will be able to acquire several bags of organic fertilizer for her potato crops.

loans.use: To buy several bags of organic fertilizer for her potato crops.

loans.name: Anzhelika

texts.ru: Анжелика торгует продуктовыми полуфабрикатами: замороженным мясом, окорочками, катлетами. Торговая точка клиента расположена в удобном и удачном месте, где большая проходимость покупателей. Анжелика всегда постоянна в своих выплатах, никогда не опаздывает. В этот раз Анжелике понадобился кредит для закупки мясной продукции.
texts.en:
