Con el deseo de salir adelante y contar con más clientes, ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para comprar diversidad de productos y así venderlos a crédito, a lo que las personas aceptan con más frecuencia y que muchas veces Lidia no puede hacer debido a su falta de capital.
texts.en:
Lidia, 26, lives with her husband who works as a security guard for a private firm.  She also lives with her two minor children.  Lidia works very hard selling cosmetics, perfume, jewelry and other products from place to place to customers via catalogue; it’s an acceptable business.  

Hoping to move forward and have more customers, she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy a variety of products to sell on credit which is the way most people want them and often Lidia can’t do it due to her lack of capital.

loans.use: to buy perfume to sell.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: Flor trabaja elaborando pupusas de forma artesanal en un comal de barro en su casa de habitación, esta forma de elaborar pupusas es muy escasa en el país, razón por la que cuenta con varios clientes ya que cocinar las pupusas en barro le da un mejor sabor. Flor vive junto a su esposo y un hijo quien trabaja y corre con sus gastos personales. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, tomates y otros ingredientes más que son muy básicos para la elaboración de las pupusas. Con esto ella espera mejorar sus ganancias lo cual es muy importante tanto para el crecimiento de su negocio como para la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
texts.en:
Flor works making pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes] in an artisanal way on a clay griddle at home.  This method of making pupusas is rare in the country which is why she has several customers because cooking pupusas on clay imparts a better flavor.

Flor lives with her husband and a son who works to cover his personal expenses.  She’s asking for a loan to buy corn, beans, fried pork, tomatoes and other ingredients that are basic for making pupusas.  She hopes this way to improve her profits which is very important both for her business’ growth and for her home’s economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fried pork, cheese and vegetables to make pupusas with.

loans.name: Armida Yolanda

texts.es: Armida de 63 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos quienes corren con sus gastos personales. Armida trabaja con mucho gusto en su propio negocio el cual es una tienda que durante años ha ido surtiendo, en el lugar donde ella reside hay muchas tiendas de productos de primera necesidad por lo que ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: galletas, dulces, jugos, sodas, lácteos, harinas, granos básicos y otros más. Con esto Armida espera mejorar sus ganancias y poder contar con una vida mejor junto a su esposo.
texts.en: Armida, 63, is a very hardworking, responsible lady.  She lives with her husband and two children who work to cover their personal expenses.  Armida works very gladly in her own business which is a store that she’s been stocking for years.  There are many grocery stores in the area where she lives which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy larger amounts of products like cookies, candy, juice, sodas, dairy products, flour, basic grains and others.  With this, Armida hopes to improve profits and have a better life along with her husband.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Support Manuel in his efforts to provide affordable car repair services to his community in Miami Florida.  Manuel emigrated from Peru in 1999 to pursue the American Dream. Since his arrival, he has worked in multiple mechanic shops, most recently as a Senior Mechanic at a large dealership. His dream, since arrival, was to become an entrepreneur and start his own business. This came true two years ago when he established his own Auto Tech business, an auto/vehicle repair shop that provides a variety of maintenance, upgrade, and repair services.  

Manuel is humble and a constant contributor to his community. Currently, he provides free repair services to single mothers, in an effort to assist those brave and struggling women.  But his efforts do not end there. As his business grows, he wants to provide economic support to impoverished youth in Peru. 

Beyond supporting Manuel’s immediate and extended family, the business also employs two people. This loan will help Manuel purchase equipment that will allow him to expand his services. In specific, the loan will allow him to purchase programming equipment that he needs in order to service expanded car brands and provide higher quality service.

loans.use: to purchase programming equipment

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Support Rodolfo in his dream of having his own construction company. Originally from Cuba, Rodolfo has been living in Miami, where he has gained experience in construction and leadership. He graduated from the School of Engineering at Florida International University and has had the opportunity of working on several engineering projects. However, he is now investing all his energy into building his own business so that one day he can secure contracts similar to those he has completed for others. 

Rodolfo recognizes that pursuing his dream is not easy. He has encountered many unexpected challenges and has met them with hard work, investment and planning. He knows that all accomplishments, regardless of their size, start in the same small way with passion and commitment. Thankfully, Rodolfo has the support of his partner, wife and life consultant, Maria, who has also worked hard to help him follow his dream and has always believed in him. 

Help support Rodolfo and Maria! This loan will be invested in a marketing campaign to help Rodolfo grow his business and get people to know him as a constructor. His ultimate goal is to be successful enough to be able to bring something back to his community in Miami.

loans.use: a marketing strategy for his company

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new equipment that would help her grow the business and hire two full time employees

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 51 años, convive con José, con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos, de 21 y 15 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia construida de material rústico en una zona agrícola. Desde los 18 años, Victoria se dedica a la agricultura con la siembra de productos como papas, arvejas, habas y otros. Al lado de José consigue obtener buenos frutos, “Mi esposo trabaja la mayor parte del tiempo en el campo, porque yo también tengo que atender mi casa”, menciona. Gracias  a los animales que  posee (vacas, toros y caballos), puede agilizar su trabajo. Los caballos le sirven para realizar traslados de sacos pesados de papas, en cuanto a sus toros, los alquila al día a 25 soles, para su uso como yuntas. Así genera ingresos por varias partes. De esa manera Victoria sale adelante y mantiene su hogar, al lado del campo, porque le agrada su trabajo. Ahora piensa adquirir más animales para mejorar su trabajo dentro del campo, por ello requiere de su apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 7 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Dos de Mayo”, y le agrada el trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero del préstamo piensa adquirir un toro, para criarlo y emplearlo en las actividades agrícolas. Calcula que le costará de 1500 a 1700 soles.
texts.en: Victoria, 51, lives with José. They have seven children, but only live with two youngest, of 21 and 15 years of age. They all live in their own house built with rustic materials in an agricultural area. Victoria has been a farmer since she was 18 years old. She sows potatoes, peas, broad beans and other. With José at her side, she’s able to get good results. “My wife works in the field most of the time because I have to take care of the house”, he mentions. Thanks to the animals she owns (cows, bulls and horses), she can speed up the work. The horses serve to transport heavy potato sacks and the bulls she rents out at 25 soles per day as yokes. That way, she generates income from various sources. Victoria gets ahead and maintains her household by working in the fields. She enjoys her work. Now she’s thinking of acquiring more animals so she can improve the work in the fields, but to do this she needs your support. This is her 7th loan from MFP. She promises to be punctual with her monthly payments. She’s part of the Communal Bank “Dos de Mayo” and she enjoys teamwork. With the loan, she’ll buy a bull to raise and employ it in agricultural activities. She calculates that this will cost her 1500 to 1700 soles.

loans.use: buy  abull.

loans.name: Fabio Antonio

texts.en: Support a Brazilian entrepreneur as he grows his carpentry business. Fabio Antonio first arrived in the United States 11 years ago and started working for a carpentry company in New York. His boss saw in him great potential and always encouraged him to open his own business. This was one of Fabio’s motivations to start FAAF Woodwork Inc in 2004. His company specializes in installations and remodeling of wooden furniture in kitchens, bathrooms, restaurants and clubs. Fabio is the only owner and employee, but he hires subcontractors when needed for the job. He is very passionate about what he does and he is constantly looking to improve and learn new things. To Fabio, success is people recognizing him for his work and having continuous upcoming projects. The biggest challenge he has is getting people to know his work. Support this hard worker entrepreneur with a loan that will help him buy new equipment to expand his business. Fabio’s goal is to keep working hard to be able to pay for his son's education and achieve his own financial stability

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda’s husband drives a tricycle as a source of income. To help him to earn more, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy oil, a mirror and four new tires for it. With these new materials, her husband would be able to generate more income and save for the education their two children.

She aims to increase his usual income because it's barely enough for their daily costs. She hopes that, with the financial support, she and her husband will earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy oil, a mirror and 4 new tires for her husband's tricycle

loans.name: Cecilia Delfilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 32 años de edad estado civil divorciada tiene 2 hijas .Su ingreso económico es con la venta de productos cosméticos  ese ha sido su medio de sustento, ya que una de sus hijas la ayuda en esta actividad, pues le va bien en su negocio su sueño es incrementar mas su negocio poner más variedad a sus productos. Su horario de trabajo es en las tardes cuando les ofrece el producto  a sus vecinos. Su sueño es lograr una gran empresa de cosméticos y poder dar trabajos a muchas mujeres solteras Con el préstamo ella va a comprar todo lo que es cosmético como: perfumes, cremas, colonias etc.
texts.en: Cecilia, 32, is divorced and has two daughters.  Her income comes from selling cosmetics; this has been her means of support.  One of her daughters helps her with this activity because she does well in the business and her dream is to increase the business and add more variety of products.  Her work schedule is evenings when she goes out to offer her products to her neighbors.  Her dream is to manage a large cosmetics firm to provide employment for many single women.  She will use the loan to buy all kinds of cosmetics: perfume, creams, cologne, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Matilde Ines

texts.es: Matilde, una diseñadora grafica que vive en Cartagena, usó su anterior préstamo para comprar un computador y una impresora de fotos. Estas dos herramientas, la ha ayudado a trabajar más fácilmente con las fotos que toma, para producir copias de ellas, fotos montadas y  mosaicos para sus clientes. Es muy importante que ella use tecnología moderna para que su trabajo sea profesional.  Ella ahora esta pidiendo otro crédito para comprar una cámara digital – esto, combinada con su nuevo computador e impresora, mejorará la calidad de su trabajo. Su mensaje a los prestamistas de Kiva es lo siguiente: “Gracias a ustedes he cumplido uno de mis sueños que era ser una empresaria de la fotografía. Espero que sigan ayudando a mas personas.”
texts.en:
Matilde is a graphic designer living in Cartagena.  She used her previous loan to buy a computer and photo printer.  These two tools have helped her work more easily with the photos she takes; to copy them, make photo montages and photo mosaics for her customers.  It’s very important for her to use modern technology so that her work will be professional.

She’s now requesting another loan to buy a digital camera.  This combined with her new computer and printer will improve the quality of her work.  

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thanks to you I have reached one of my dreams: to become a photography businesswoman.  I hope you will continue helping more people.”

loans.use: to buy a digital camera.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.en: Support Hernando in his efforts to expand his Miami-based marketing company, "Sphere Marketing and Advertising Inc." Hernando is originally from Colombia and came to the United States five years ago looking for a better future for his family. He is proud to be the owner of the company he started to work with when he arrived in the United States. He was able to consolidate a company that understands clients' needs to know how to sell and market a new or existing product. Hernando's biggest challenge was surviving the financial crisis when most of his clients reduced their budgets for TV and radio commercials. Hernando is fully dedicated to expanding his work and has found a niche in providing specialized services to distributors of natural products, which base most of their sales on advertising. Hernando’s company designs marketing campaigns for this type of client. He offers a full package of radio / TV / graphic advertising. For infomercials, he buys "air space" on Spanish TV channels. He still does not have the working capital and equipment to produce an infomercial, so he hires an independent contractor when needed. Costs for TV space and video productions are very high, so Hernando is looking for a loan that he can use to buy TV air time in advance, which would increase his profitability and strengthen his position to negotiate better prices with local and national channels. This loan will help him expand his service and at the same time generate more jobs.

loans.use: TV air time

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: Doña Corina es una señora de 57 años de edad, casada. Vive con su esposo, una hija y una nieta. Es una señora no vidente desde hace seis años. Humilde y trabajadora. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia en todas las ocasiones. A pesar de su enfermedad, hace un año vió la necesidad de dedicarse a vender refrescos gaseosos y golosinas en su casa, debido que para ella no es un obstáculo para poder superarse. Es primera vez que solicita un préstamo a la Fundación. El crédito lo va invertir en reforzar su pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Corina, 57, lives with her husband, daughter and granddaughter.  She’s been blind for six years.  She’s humble and hardworking.  She has her family’s support always.  Despite her illness a year ago she needed to start selling soft-drinks and snacks at home because it’s not an obstacle for her to improve herself.  This is the first time she’s requested a loan from the Fundación and she will use it to strengthen he small business.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo Amarildo con quien tiene 2 hijos: Robert de 13 y Miguel de 8 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia que construyeron con esfuerzo y se ubica en un anexo rural. Sonia es una mujer seria y centrada. Se dedica a la agricultura. El trabajo que diariamente realiza Sonia en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus sembríos de arveja y gladiolo sean uno de los mejores cultivados del poblado de Patay. 
Todas las mañanas sale muy temprano a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que es muy importante que las tenga bien cuidadas.
Son casi 10 años los que lleva trabajando en el campo y le agrada ver sus resultados cada vez que cosecha. En adelante, espera comprará nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción, es una de sus metas. 
Ahora se esforzará en el cultivo de arvejas y flores de gladiolos, para ello requiere de su apoyo. Éste es el préstamo número 11 con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagar a tiempo sus cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima”, cuyos socios son personas responsables.
Destinará los 3000 soles del préstamo en la compra de semillas de arvejas y gladiolos. Asi también comprará bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 29 years old, lives with her husband Amarildo with whom she has 2 children: Robert, 13 years old, and Miguel who is 8. Together they live in their own house that they built with great effort and is located in a rural annex. Sonia is a serious and focused woman. She works in agriculture for a living. The work that Sonia does daily is in her gardens, has made some of the best cultivated pea and gladiolo crops in the town of Patay.
Every morning she goes out very early to work her land, as she knows that it is very important that they are well maintained.
It's almost 10 years that she has carried on working in the field and enjoys seeing the results each time that she harvests. Going forward, she hope she will buy new land to increase her production. It is one of her goals.
Now she will strengthen in the cultivation of peas and gladioli flowers, and that requires your support. This is the 11th loan with MFP and she feels the obligation of making her payments on time. She belongs to the communal bank “Virgen de Fátima”, whose members are responsible people. She will designate the 3000 soles from the loan to the purchase of pea and gladioli seeds. She will also buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase pea and gladioli seeds, as well as bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Vilma Rosa

texts.es: Vilma tiene 39 años de edad tiene 2 hijos uno de 17 y el otro de7 años .Desde que era ella  muy joven  su madre le enseño lo que la confección de ropa eso a ella le encanto por lo que ahora ese es su  trabajo ella tiene una maquina en su casa, la cual elabora camisas, pantalones en su taller que con mucho esfuerzo a conseguido .Por eso con el préstamo ella quiere comprar cosas como: hilo, tela y otra máquina de coser bordadora
texts.en: Vilma, 39, has two children who are 17 and 7 years old.  Since she was very young her mother taught her dressmaking and she loved it.  Now it’s her occupation and she has a sewing machine at home she uses to make shirts and pants in the workshop she managed to get with much effort.  Because of this she wants to use the loan to buy such things as thread, fabric and another embroidering sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy such things as thread, fabric and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria  Moncerratte

texts.es: Rita Desde que era ella  muy joven  comenzó estudiando en un curso de corte y confección, eso a ella le encanto, después logro comprarse una máquina de coser .Por lo que ahora ese es su  trabajo ella tiene una maquina en su casa, la cual elabora camisas, pantalones en su taller que con mucho esfuerzo a conseguido .Por eso con el préstamo ella quiere comprar cosas como: hilo, tela y otra máquina de coser bordadora etc.
texts.en: Rita started taking sewing and dress-making courses since she was very young; she loved it.  Later she managed to buy a sewing machine.  Now, this is her occupation and she has a sewing machine at home that she uses to make shirts and pants in her workshop that she’s managed to get through much effort.  This is why she wants to use the loan to buy such things as thread, fabric, another embroidering sewing machine, etc.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies like thread, fabric and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es: Doña Lilian es una mujer con 41 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Ella vive con su esposo, sus dos hijos y una nieta. Su hijo menor estudia y la mayor trabaja. Es trabajadora y tiene visión empresarial. Su negocio se llama Digicentro MyL, ahí prestan los servicios de fotocopiado, levantados de textos, impresiones, se toman fotografías, también vende artículos escolares y de oficina. Tiene seis años de experiencia y gracias a la buena administración le va muy bien. En ocasiones cuenta con contratos de algunas escuelas y colegios, además de empresas de la misma comunidad. El préstamo lo va invertir en comprar materia prima como cartuchos de tintas, papel para impresiones de fotos y certificados honoríficos y más.
texts.en: Lilian is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two.  She lives with her husband, two children, and her niece.  Her youngest son attends school and her daughter works.  Lilian is a hardworking woman with an entrepreneurial vision.  Her business is called “Digicentro MyL,” where she provides photocopy services, transcription, printing, photographs, and also sells school and office supplies.  She’s been doing this for six years and things have been going well thanks to her good management.  Sometimes she gets some special contracts from schools, friends, or other companies in the community.  She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as ink cartridges, photo paper, award certificates, and other things.

loans.use: to buy printing supplies.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es: La Sra. Genara  tiene 39 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son dos varones de 16 y 17 años y una mujercita de 19 años, todos se encuentran estudiando en la universidad,   la señora se dedica a reparar llantas, parchado, vulcanización y cambio de llantas en su taller que se encuentra en la  zona de Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Genara va a usar este préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo, como gatas y llaves por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero y el cliente se vio interesado por los prestamos Kiva, la Sra. Genara enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el que su taller no se encuentra en una zona estratégica  y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando herramientas que le falten,  su deseo  es que quiere ayudar con sus ingresos a su familia.
texts.en: Genara, 39, is married and has three children; two boys who are 16 and 17 years old and a girl who is 19.  All of them are attending university.  She works repairing tires, patching, vulcanizing and replacing tires in her shop located in Villa Fátima.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Genara will use it to buy work tools like jacks and wrenches.  Her reason for requesting the loan is lack of money and she’s interested in Kiva loans.  The business challenge Genara faces is that her shop is not located in a strategic location and she’s going to use profits to continue buying the tools she needs.  Her wish is to always be able to help her family with her income.

loans.use: to buy work tools like jacks and wrenches.

loans.name: Anatou Alakè

texts.fr: Agée de 60ans, Anatou est une veuve et mère deux enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 18ans et 13ans. Elle vend des produits de beauté et des bijoux depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes dans l'un des marchés du Bénin en vue de les revendre en détail. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Anatou, age 60, is a widow and mother of two children aged 13 and 18 who go to school. She has been selling beauty products and jewelry for a few years, and she buys her stock from wholesalers at a market in Benin to resell at retail. 

To bolster her sales and meet customer demand, she requested and obtained a loan from Finadev. This credit will help her to maximise her profits and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one carton of mixed brands of body lotions, one carton of creams, one carton of soaps, and five jewelry sets.

loans.name: Reynalyn

texts.en:
Reynalyn’s business provides her family’s daily expenditures. She has been in this beauty parlor since 2010 and she wishes to expand her business.  She would able to do this if she has stable funds to use. 

To make it possible, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy new scissors, a blower, and different hair medication. She hopes that her wish to diversify her parlor will be soon achieved.

loans.use: to buy new scissors, a blower, and different hair medication.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 41 years old and has engaged herself in direct selling.  She sells different products such as empty spray bottles, perfumes, face powder, and whitening soap. She has been operating this source of income since 2000 and she is very much thankful for its great help to their living. 

Now that her four children are increasing their educational needs, she wants to also increase her income to meet all the needs of her children. 

To yield higher proceeds, she is requesting additional capital in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase bottled water, bottle spray, a variety of perfumes, lipstick, and whitening soap. She wishes that the funds provided will increase the inventory of the business as well as its income generated.

loans.use: to purchase bottled water, bottle spray, a variety of perfumes, lipstick, and whitening soap.

loans.name: Esperlina

texts.en:
Esperlina is a 49-year-old who has a tricycle that is operated by her husband. This activity is an additional source of income for the couple; they are also farmers. They continue to pursue tricycle transportation because there are few vehicles or modes of transportation in their barrio.

Now, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP for exterior and interior repairs to their tricycle. They hope to maintain the tricycle so they can continue to help others by providing transportation services.

loans.use: to pay for exterior and interior repairs to her tricycle

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a housewife who has a tricycle that is operated by her husband. They have been in this business for over five years and wish for higher income. 

Now, Emely is requesting PHP 10,000 to buy a new piston ring, oil, pulsar coil, and connecting rod. She hopes that through these materials, their tricycle will be become stronger and yield higher income for the study costs of her two children.

loans.use: to buy a new piston ring, oil, pulsar coil, and connecting rod.

loans.name: Yadira Cándida

texts.es:
"Así somos los sauceños en todo vamos de primero aunque nunca nos quitemos ni el caite ni el sombrero pero nos sentimos orgullosos de ser originarios de este pequeño pueblo luchador." -Yadira Cándida

Así es doña Yadira Cándida una señora de 47 años que desde que se casó y formó su hogar se dedica al comercio donde su negocio consiste en una Fritanga ubicada en su vivienda donde ofrece a sus clientes riquísima carne asada, tacos, enchiladas, tajadas y pollo asado donde lo habitual por los pobladores  es adquirirlo  para la cena.

Se dedica a este oficio desde hace 11 años el que le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de carne de cerdo, pollo, aceite, crema, verduras y plátanos con el objetivo de brindarles mayor variedad de comida a sus clientes y así atraer a los mismos.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a los pequeños comerciantes que necesitan de este capital para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
"That’s how we Sauceños are with everything; we are leaders even though we refuse to let go of our rural ways. We are proud to be natives of this tough little town." -Yadira Cándida

This is Yadira Cándida a woman of 47 years old. Since she married and formed her home, she works in a shop where her business consists of Fritanga (grilled meat and fried cow intestines) located in her house where she offers her customers delicious roasted meats, tacos, enchiladas, fried plantain slices and roasted chicken where it is usual for the inhabitants to buy for dinner.She has been working in this trade for 11 years which has allowed her to help her husband with household expenses and provide a better life for their children.

She is requesting this loan to purchase pork, chicken, oil, cream, vegetables and plantains in order to provide greater variety of food to her customers and therefore attract them. She thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they provide to small businesses that need this capital to move forward.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken, oil, cream, vegetables and plantains.

loans.name: Evelia Margarita

texts.es: Evelia había Solicitado un préstamo para comprar mercancía para su negocio de ventas mediante guías especializadas o catalogo; gracias a los prestamistas de Kiva, ella pudo comprar ropa, perfumería, y bisutería para vender a sus clientes y aumentar sus cuentas por cobrar. Este negocio es lucrativo para ella, pero Evelia también tiene experiencia en vender productos alimenticios y la interesa mucho el tema de la salud. Ella está Solicitando un nuevo crédito de Kiva para comprar productos medicinales, que son muy conocidos por sus beneficios para la salud y venderlos a clientes que ya los han solicitado. Evelia quiere decir lo siguiente a sus fondeadores: “Les agradezco, hasta ahora me han apoyado bastante y gracias a este apoyo mi negocio ha crecido.”
texts.en:
Evelia had requested a loan to buy merchandise for her business selling goods via specialized catalogues.  Thanks to Kiva lenders she was able to buy clothes, perfumery and costume jewelry to sell to her customers and increase her accounts receivable.  This is a profitable business for her but Evelia also has experience selling nutritional products and she’s very interested in the subject of health.

She’s asking for a new Kiva loan to buy medicinal products that are well-known and have health benefits to sell to customers that have requested them.  Evelia wants to say the following to her lenders: “I am very grateful to you.  You have been a great support for me to date and thanks to your support my business has grown.”

loans.use: to buy medicinal products.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is 49 years old and a married mother who has been blessed with five children. She resides in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. 

To support the family, she has been working as a tailor, while her husband helps to earn extra income for the family by working for others for a fee. Engaging in this business for two years, Ry and her husband can earn approximately US $11 per day and manage to save about US $5 each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Ry has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. The past loans, which she successfully paid back, have relieved her family’s burden and improved their livelihood. 

Now she would like to acquire a loan of US $1,000 from VisionFund. Ry will use this loan to buy fabrics for her tailoring business and use a portion of it to spend on purchasing rice for resale. She hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 41 years old and married with one child.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

Analiza has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Analiza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.fr: Agée de 51ans, Sofia est une veuve et mètre de 06 enfants qui sont déjà à leur propre charge. L'aîné a 35ans et le benjamin a 25ans. Spécialisée dans la distribution des bijoux dans les marchés de la ville depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Sofia, age 51, is a widow and mother of six independent children aged 25 to 35. She specializes as a jewelry distributor at the local markets. She has been in this line of work for a few years, and she buys her stock from wholesalers at a market in Benin. 

To bolster her purchasing power and meet customer demand, she requested a loan from Finadev. This credit will help her to maximise her profits and to support herself.

loans.use: to buy 50 jewelry sets for resale.

loans.name: Kanha's Group

texts.en:
Kanha is 30 years old and a married mother of two children. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. The main income of the family is from farming rice and providing tailoring services. Her husband is also employed in a local garment factory to earn additional income. Having been involved in this business for nine years, Kanha and her husband are able to earn about 22,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield in the rice farming business resulted from insufficient working capital, which is still the main challenge.
 
Kanha is a new borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group is composed of four members who live in the same village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of 800,000 KHR each. Kanha, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and utilize a portion of it to spend on labor costs in transplanting rice seedling and water pumping. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice successfully so as to improve hygienic living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cultivated land

loans.name: José De La Concepción

texts.es:
José de la Concepción, originario de la capital, casado, una persona responsable, honesto, con muchos deseos de superación, desde hace muchos años que inicio su negocio venta de Electrodomésticos, gaseosas Jugos pero su producto mas grande en inventario o que tiene mejor rotación son Juguetes.

Un día de trabajo de José inicia cuando llega a su negocio que esta ubicado en  uno de los mercados de Managua, a las ocho de la mañana es que empieza sus labores, Lo primero que hace una limpieza a sus productos con el objetivo de tener siempre presentable y en buen estado los juguetes que comercializa, esto da una impresión que están frescos y recién comprados aunque sea un producto que ya se ha comprado hace días, ya que el compra y almacena mercadería, terminando su Jornada a las seis de la tarde. Sus mejores  temporadas son entre la Navidad que inicia a mover el producto desde Noviembre, Diciembre, enero y febrero; en Enero Nicaragua celebra a los Reyes Magos una tradición donde se regalan Juguetes a los Niños, José  también  aprovecha estos festejos por que es cuando mas  vende y Febrero  inician las clases y él cuenta con productos variados como mochilas escolares. 

Este crédito lo solicita para compra de Juguetes, furgones, juego de té, Robot, Transforme, Muñecas, carros. Para comercializar  en esta temporada de Navidad.

Agradece a CEPRODEL y KIVA por el apoyo que le puedan brindar ya que este crédito ayudara a surtir más su negocio y lograr comprar productos y tener almacenado para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
José de la Concepción, a native of the capital, is married.  He's a responsible and honest person with a great desire for self-improvement.  Many years ago he started his business selling electrical appliances, sodas, and juice.  His biggest inventory product, though, or the one that has most turnover, is toys.

José's work day starts at 8 in the morning when he arrives at his business, located in one of the markets in Managua.  The first thing he does is clean his products so the toys he sells will always be presentable and in good condition.  This gives the impression that they're fresh and recently purchased, even though it might be something he bought days ago, because he buys and stores merchandise.  He ends his day at 6 in the afternoon.

His best seasons are between Christmas and January and February.  He begins to sell products from November and December.  In January Nicaragua celebrates the Three Kings, a tradition when children receive toys.  José also takes advantage of these celebrations because it's when he sells most.  And in February classes begin and he has a variety of products such as backpacks for students.

He's requesting this loan to buy toys, trucks, a tea set, a robot, Transformers, dolls, and cars to sell during the Christmas season.

He's grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva for their support because this loan will help to supply his business and buy and stock products to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy toys for the Christmas season

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business making and selling candles in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy candle-making materials.

Arlinda has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Arlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her candle-making business

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio Larreynaga  departamento de León, La señora Sandra se Desempeña como maestra de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 27 años, tambien cuenta con un pequeño pulperia, es Soltera con 2 hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Sandra  atraviesa, es la de comprar productos para su pulperia ya que existe la inestabilidad de precio, y el financiamiento le beneficiaria ya que compraría por mayor y no se miraría afectado su negocio, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra carne de pollo, carne de res, carne de cerdo, arroz, aceite ,tomate, cebolla, gas, cocinera, salsa, frijoles y tortillas,  y ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.

La señora Sandra agradece a ceprodel por el crédito oportuno y la oportunidad misma de favorecer a través del mismo a los sectores mas vulnerables.
texts.en:
In the town of Larreynaga in the department of Leon, Sandra works as a primary school teacher in a small county school. She has been doing this since she was 27 years old. She also runs a small grocery store.  She is single with 2 children whom she has to provide the necessary conditions for development.

One of the needs that Sandra experiences is that of buying products for her grocery store since prices are unstable. The loan will benefit her because she will buy in bulk and her business won't be affected by the fluctuations. For that reason she has decided to ask Ceprodel for a loan to buy chicken, beef, pork, rice, oil, salsa, beans and tortillas as well as a cook. Being the beneficiary of this loan will improve her living conditions.

Sandra is grateful to Ceprodel for the credit opportunity and the chance to help the most vulnerable sectors.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, pork, rice, oil, tomato, onion, gas, salsa, beans and tortillas and pay a cook.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: El negocio de María es la venta de maíz trillado en el mercado, y ella usó su crédito anterior para comprar maíz para trillar y vender a sus clientes. En ese momento, él maíz estaba escaso y fue muy importante que ella mantenga su clientela con una provisión de maíz. Ella ahora está solicitando un nuevo crédito de Kiva para comprar mas maíz, para preparar para las temporadas de crisis o cuando esté  escaso . Ella quiere decir lo siguiente a sus fondeadores que está muy agradecida con los créditos y que trabaja para tener un monto de crédito mas alto, para trabajar mas cómodamente con esta sola entidad.
texts.en:
María’s business is selling hulled corn in the market.  She used her previous loan to buy more corn to hull and sell to her customers.  At that time, corn was scarce and it was very important for her to retain her customers by providing them with corn.  She’s now requesting a new Kiva loan to buy more corn to be ready for crisis times or for when it’s scarce.

She wants to say the following to her lenders:  that she’s very grateful for the loans and she’s working towards being able to get higher amounts so that she can comfortably work with just this entity.

loans.use: to buy more corn for crisis times or for when it's scarce.

loans.name: Maria Eustaquia

texts.es:
La señora María de 59 años de edad es casada, vive con dos de sus cuatro hijos, ya que dos son independientes, tambien vive con su esposo en  su casa de habitación, tiene vivienda propia, se  ha dedicado durante varios años al negocio de venta de pan, tamales, leche y cuajada, su venta es de manera ambulante, radica en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras. 
Doña María esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de maíz, leña, harina, huevos, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea mejorar el tejado de su casa, su deseo es que su negocio crezca y que su ganado de leche se mejore con las lluvias de este año.
Doña María Sueña con una casa mejor.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 59 years old. She is married and lives with two of her four children, since two of them are living on their own, and her husband in her house. They have their own house. 

For many years María, has been making a living from the sale of bread, tamales, milk and curd. She sells these as a street vendor. 

She is located in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. 

María is asking for 10,000 lempiras to purchase corn, firewood, flour and eggs. 

With the help of this loan she wants to improve the roof of her house. She hopes that her business will grow and that her dairy cattle will improve with the rainfall this year. 

María is dreaming of a better home. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – September 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, flour and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Antonia Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Antonia tiene 37 años es casada con tres hijos que son de las edades de 8, 12 y 17 años de edad, ella   vive por la zona de Marcelo Quiroga,   La Sra. Antonia  se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Antonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de productos para surtir su negocio como abarrotes y refrescos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Antonia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Antonia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Antonia, 37, is married and has three children who are 8, 12 and 17 years of age.  She lives in the Marcelo Quiroga zone.  Antonia sells a variety of basic staple items in her grocery store located in the same neighborhood where she lives.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Antonia will use it to buy a variety of goods like groceries and soft-drinks to stock her store to provide more variety of products for her customers.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving her business and Antonia will use profits to continue buying products and improve her income.  Her wish for the business is to have a warehouse to provide better customer service.  Antonia is a hardworking woman who feels happy about the opportunity being provided her.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks at wholesale and to buy groceries.

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: Alberto vive en Cartagena y su negocio es la venta de café, gaseosas, papitas fritas y otros tentempiés. Alberto tiene 43 años, pero el negocio tiene ya 38 años: fue el negocio de su papá, y desde muy joven Alberto trabajó con él vendiendo café. Cuando su padre dejó de trabajar por su edad avanzada, él siguió manejando el negocio, aumentado el número de productos. El fuerte del negocio sigue siendo el café, el cual comienza a vender desde las cinco de la mañana, todos los días. En la actualidad está aplicando a un primer financiamiento de Kiva, con el cual comprar  productos alimenticios, que no ofrece en el momento y con ello continuar ampliando sus ofertas, y también para arreglar el kiosco,  preparándose para una reubicación que le tienen programada y dará mas fuerzas a Alberto, porque su nueva ubicación ofrecerá una mejor vista al negocio, para que  policías, campesinos y otros trabajadores, que son su principal mercado, puedan encontrarlo más fácilmente por la mañana, cuando buscan deleitarse con un café Colombiano.  Alberto tiene 2 hijos y una hija entre las edades de 11 y 15 años, y él quiere mucho que ellos puedan seguir estudiando y es justamente su gran sueño y mayor desafio.
texts.en:
Alberto lives in Cartagena and he sells coffee, soft drinks, potato chips, and other snacks.  Alberto is 43 years old, but the business is 38 years old.  It used to belong to his father and he used to work with him, selling coffee, when he was young and took over the business when his father became too old to work it.  He increased the number of products, but coffee continues to be the main business.  He begins selling every morning at 5:00am.

He is currently working with his first Kiva loan and he will use it to buy food products that he doesn’t currently offer so that he can expand his business.  He also wants to fix up his kiosk and prepare to move to a better location where police, field hands, and other workers, who are his primary customers, can easily find him in the mornings, when they are looking for Colombian coffee.  Alberto has two sons and one daughter, all between the ages of 11 and 15.  He really wants them to stay in school and it’s his greatest dream and challenge.

loans.use: to buy inventory and to move his kiosk.

loans.name: Maximiliano Ivan

texts.es: Maximiliano tiene 36 años de edad estado civil casado , su profesión es taxista pero su esposa tiene un bazar . EL Le compro una vitrina y perchas de allí ella vende laminas, cuadernos hasta artículos de bazar. Ella Atiende su pequeño negocio sola. Ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Ella cuenta que al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio  pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando esas condiciones pues ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio y su sueño es ampliarlo más para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que dio a día le compran en su bazar. Y Ella cuenta que quisiera arreglar su vivienda y el sueño de ella es comprarse otro carro. Con el préstamo quisiera comprar: artículos para el bazar, papeles, láminas,  etc.
texts.en: Maximiliano, 36, is married and is at taxi driver by profession but his wife has a store.  He bought her a display case and shelving and she sells printed laminated sheets, notebooks and household goods.  She tends to her small business alone and starts work at 8 am and ends at 10pm.  She relates that at the beginning crime in her area was high and business productivity was low but conditions have been gradually improving and now she’s doing very well in her business and her dream is to expand it to better satisfy the needs of customers that visit her establishment daily to buy from her.  She relates that she’d also like to make some home improvements and dreams with buying another car.  She will use the loan to buy household goods, paper, laminated sheets, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Osman. He is married and has four children aged one, six, nine and thirteen years. In 2006, Osman established his electronics business selling such items as radios, tapes, watches, memory sticks, and electric lights. He began his business because after the rebel war, things were so difficult for his family; they lost everything. He stayed in his village doing petty trade from one village to another until he saved enough to be able to relocate to Makeni Town. He started dealing on watches, and over some years his business improved gradually.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 863,700 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Osman has already received and successfully repaid two loans. He now requires a new loan in order to purchase tapes (50 pieces at Le 40,000); radios with memory cards (10 pieces at Le 50,000); electronic lanterns (one dozen for Le 500,000) and watches (100 pieces at Le 10,000). 

In the future, Osman plans to open a shop and build a house.  The loan will help because it is a means of generating income. Competition is one tough issue, but he purchases a quality and quantity of goods that give him the lead in the market. He is hardworking and competitive. Having good capital will boost his business, and continued access to loans will enable him to achieve his goals. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase tapes (50 pieces at Le 40,000); radios with memory cards (10 pieces at Le 50,000); electronic lanterns (one dozen for Le 500,000) and watches (100 pieces at Le 10,000).

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu, 35, is divorced and has three children ages 9, 12 and 15. All attend school. In 2008, Isatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she was given in an early marriage and went through a lot of hard times in her matrimonial home. With the help of a friend who counseled her, she decided to do petty trading. She toils day and night to be successful in her business as it is the only way that she can sustain herself and her children. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le1,053,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase wax cotton fabric (200 pieces @ Le100,000), African clothing for men (10 suits @ Le120,000) and women's attire (eight suits @ Le100,000). In the future, Isatu plans to open a boutique. The rise and fall of foreign exchange is her major problem. She needs good capital to improve her business and accessing a loan here will achieve that. She is honest and reliable. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase wax cotton fabric, African clothing for men and women's attire.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil casada tiene2 hijos .Ella comenzó en la venta de comida trabajando para un hermano de ella, actualmente ella se independizo y trabaja junto a su hija .Ella trabaja desde la 6.am hasta 15:00pm ella vende empanadas y tortillas. Su meta es tener un gran restaurante de comidas típicas ecuatorianas .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar una cocina una y ollas y platos
texts.en: Rosa, 42, is married and has two children.  She started out selling food working for her brother but she’s now independent and working with her daughter.  She works from 6am until 3pm selling turnovers and tortillas.  Her goal is to own a great restaurant serving traditional Ecuadoran dishes.  She wants to use the loan to buy a stove and some pots and dishes.

loans.use: to buy a stove, pots and dishes.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu, 48, is a widow and has five children, ages 10, 21, 28, 30 and 32. Two are going to school. In 2009, Isatu established her footwear (plastic slippers) business. She began her business because she got married at an early age and could not continue her schooling. She began doing petty trading at home.  After her husband's death, she set up this business in the market. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le 579,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy slippers for men (100 pieces @ Le15,000), slippers for women (100 @ Le7,000), sandals for children (60 pieces @ Le5,000) and sandals for men (50 pieces @ Le10,000). In the future, Isatu plans to open a bigger shop and expand her business. Cost of transportation is her major problem. She is hardworking and honest. She hopes to access more loans after paying this one. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy slippers for men and women, sandals for children and sandals for men.

loans.name: Idrissa J.

texts.en: Idrissa, 36, is married and has five children, ages 1, 5, 10, 12 and 16. Three are going to school. In 2004, Idrissa established his stationery and cosmetics business. He began his business because he lacked financial support that forced him to drop out of school in his Sixth Form. He had wanted to go to college but his parents could not afford the amount to see him through. He had to rely on petty trading. He did his best and he has done a lot for himself.  Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 617,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Idrissa requires a loan in order to purchase exercise books (12 cartons @ Le200,000) and foam laundry soap (10 cartons @ Le60,000). In the future, Idrissa plans to educate his children at whatever level they choose.  The loan is another source of income to help him. The rainy season is his major problem because the mud on the road prevents customers from going to the market. His business is growing and he needs more capital to build it to a giant level. Idrissa is a hardworking and persuasive and offers good customer service.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase exercise books and foam laundry soap.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: Federico usó su último crédito de Kiva para comprar más productos para su negocio donde vende gran variedad de mercancías. Su negocio, básicamente, es vender todo lo que demandan sus clientes: pijamas, cosméticos, toallas y más. Con su crédito anterior, por ejemplo, compró perfumería y productos de belleza. Ahora está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para adquirir ropa y calzados, porque recién ha tenido mucha demanda para estos productos. Federico quiere decir lo siguiente a sus fondeadores: “Gracias por apoyarme en mi negocio ya que no hay muchos opciones laborales.”
texts.en: Federico used his previous Kiva loan to buy more products for his business where he sells a great variety of merchandise.  His business basically is selling everything his customers request: pajamas, cosmetics, towels and others.  For example, he used his previous loan to buy perfumery and beauty products.  Now, he’s applying for a new loan to buy clothes and shoes because he’s had much demand for these products recently.  Federico wants to say the following to his lenders: “Thanks for supporting me in my business because there aren’t many employment options.”

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has six children aged 18, 20, 25, 29, 32 and 35 years. One is in college. In 1989, Mohamed established his footwear business selling such items as sandals and plastic slippers. He began his business because his father did not send him to school, as he believed that business is the best way for a man to sustain his family. He learned a lot from his late father who helped him set up his own business. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 983,000 every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid five loans. He now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock. He will use the loan to purchase ladies' slippers (thirty packets at Le 100,000); sandals for men (ten packets at Le 110,000); sandals for children (six packets at Le 120,000) and foam slippers (two packets at Le 90,000). 

In the future, Mohamed plans to develop and train his children to the level that they can be able to take over when he retires. He is an honest and reliable business man. ARD has helped him develop a sustainable business, thus he is very grateful to this credit service. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' slippers (thirty packets at Le 100,000); sandals for men (ten packets at Le 110,000); sandals for children (six packets at Le 120,000) and foam slippers (two packets at Le 90,000).

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Kadiatu. She is divorced and has two children, aged 18 and 21, one of whom is in college. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is attending school and helping with domestic work.

Kadiatu dropped out of school at the secondary level and got married at an early age because her parents did not value education then; her husband was a business man who taught her how to trade. After they divorced, she decided to set up her own business. In 2008, Kadiatu established her bar and drinks business. Working seven days a week and 17 hours a day, she now earns about Le 1,271,000 every month from her business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase Becks beer (4 cartons @ Le 120,000), soft drinks (30 crates @ Le 30,000), Vicco malt drink (10 cartons @ Le 50,000), Strong Stout (10 cartons @ Le 130,000), Maltina drink (10 crates @ Le 50,000), Parrot drink (10 crates @ Le 30,000) and pure drinking water (8 bundles @ Le 2,500).

In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business. The loan will help to improve her business. The rainy season is her major problem as the number of customers decreases because of the heavy rains. She is a hard-working and honest business woman. She hopes to access more loans from this credit service. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase Becks beer, soft drinks, Vicco malt drinks, Strong Stout, Maltina drink, Parrot drink and pure drinking water for her bar and drinks business.

loans.name: Ibrahim S.

texts.en: Ibrahim S. is married and has five children, ages 6, 11, 15, 18 and 21, all school going children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he is an orphan. In 2007, Ibrahim S. established his used bicycle business. He began his business because he lost his parents at a tender age and was unable to further his schooling. At the age of 18, he went to work in mining. He mined for some years and the money he got was used to establish a used shoe business.  Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 3730000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Ibrahim S. has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy mountain bicycles size 26 (12 pieces @ Le295,000) mountain bicycles size 24 (eight pieces @ Le270,000) and motocross bicycles (BMX) size 20 (two pieces @ Le150,000). In the future, Ibrahim S. plans to build a house, provide quality education for his children, acquire a shop and buy a car. This loan will help him to accomplish some of his future plans. His major challenge is inadequate capital. He is a hardworking and trustworthy business man.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mountain bicycles and motocross bicycles.

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.es:
Tarcila tiene 53 años y vive en el municipio de Cartagena, en la costa caribeña. Su negocio consiste en la venta de mercancías varias como cosméticos, ropa, papelería y más. Desde muy joven, Tarcila siempre tenia en su mente la idea de tener un negocio de variedades. Sus hermanas ya vendían mercancías, y hace 9 años, con su apoyo y el préstamo de algunas mercancías, Tarcila logro empezar su propio negocio. Poco a poco con las ganancias, ella ahorró y compró unas vitrinas para organizar mejor sus productos, y siguió así creciendo por 9 años. 
Tarcila aun continúa trabajando con mucho esmero, para ahorrar y seguir adelante, sobre todo porque tiene 3 hijos entre las edades de 18 y 22 años. En la actualidad está solicitando un crédito de Kiva para comprar más ropa para niños, ropa interior, y papelería, porque quiere surtir su negocio de muchas más mercancías para que crezca aun más, especialmente en una época como el segundo semestre del año donde usualmente sus ventas se incrementan y ella si aprovecha gana mucho más.Con su credikiva comprará ropa, interiores infantiles, y papelería . En el futuro, a Tarcila le gustaría usar sus ahorros, para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, y espera que con la ayuda de Kiva, poder aumentar sus ingresos y es que este es finalmente con este objetivo.
texts.en:
Tarcila, 53, lives in the municipality of Cartagena on the Caribbean coast.  Her business consists in selling assorted merchandise like cosmetics, clothes, stationery supplies and others.  Since a very young age, Tarcila always thought about having a variety store.  Her sisters were already selling merchandise and nine years ago with support from them and the loan of some merchandise Tarcila managed to start her own business.  As she gradually earned profits she started saving and bought some display cases to better organize her goods and continued growing this way for nine years.  Tarcila is still working very hard to save and continue forward above all because she has three children aged 18 to 22.  

She’s currently asking for a Kiva loan to buy children’s clothes, underwear and stationery supplies because she wants to stock her store with much more merchandise so that it will grow still more especially during the second semester of the year which is when sales usually increase and she can take advantage of this and earn much more.

She will use her Kiva loan to buy clothes, children’s underwear and stationery supplies.  In the future, Tarcila would like to use her savings to make some home improvements and hopes that with Kiva’s help she will be able to increase her income which is actually her ultimate objective to do so.

loans.use: to buy clothes, children's underwear and stationery supplies.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: Martha compró bolsos escolares, calzado deportivo y aprovechó la temporada inicial del año escolar para hacer una buena venta y esto fue gracias a su anterior credikiva.. En la acutualidad está aplicando a un nuevo creidkiva, con el cual comprará perfumes cosméticos para cubrir pedidos que tiene en conmemoración del dia del amor y de la amistad y así aprovechar una vez mas la época con productos apropiados para ella. Ella dice a sus financiadores que es muy importante el apoyo que le brindan para sacar adelante su negocio y reconocemos que con su gran esfuerzo muy seguramente lo logrará.
texts.en:
Martha bought schoolbags as well as sports footwear, and took advantage of the back-to-school season in order to make good sales.This was thanks to her previous Kiva loan. 

Currently she is applying for a new loan, that she will use to buy perfumes and cosmetics, in order to fill orders that she has in commemoration of the "Day of Love and Friendship" (a Colombian holiday celebrated on the third Saturday of September).This way, she will once more take advantage of the time of year, with products appropriate for it. 

To her lenders she says that the support they offer her is very important in helping her business progress. With her great effort, she will most certainly  achieve it.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and cosmetics in order to fill orders.

loans.name: Horison Manuel

texts.es: Horinson con su credikiva anterior compró rapidamente pescado en mayor volumen y así mismo los vendió, Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo finamciamiento con Kiva porque le fue muy bien, y quiere repetir, por eso hizo su preventa y le encargaron, pescado salmon,robalo, jurel, camaron y sierra. Con este nuevo financiamiento espera mejorar aun mas el servicio a su clientela, para conservarla. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Estoy muy contento con su ayuda ya que mi negocio está creciendo mas y he mejorado mis ingresos, muchisimas gracias y que Dios los bendiga. "
texts.en: Horinson used his previous Kiva loan to quickly buy fish in large amounts and he sold them.  Today, he’s applying for a new loan with Kiva because he did very well and he wants to repeat.  This is why he did a presale and he has orders for salmon, sea bass, scad, shrimp and swordfish.  He hopes to improve customer service still more with this loan so that he can retain his clientele.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very happy with your help because my business is growing and I’ve improved my income.  Thank you very much and may God bless you.”

loans.use: to buy salmon, sea bass, scad, shrimp and swordfish.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Memunatu. She is married, and has six children aged 12, 15, 20, 25, 20 and 36 years. Three are school-going children. In 1997, Memunatu established her groundnuts business. She began her business because her uncle's wife discouraged support of her schooling and instead persuaded Memunatu to join her in business. She had no alternative but to agree with her uncle's wife plans as her poor parents couldn’t provide enough to take care of her and her younger ones. She put her effort and concentration on everything her uncle's wife taught her, knowledge on which she is living now. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about Le 865,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Memunatu has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase groundnuts (10 bags at Le 400,000). Competition is great but having more stock will enable her gain market share.

In the future, Memunatu plans to educate her school-going children to a higher level and to save enough money for her retirement. She is hardworking and committed to her business. She has benefited a lot from prior loans she has taken from this credit service, and she is looking forward to subsequent loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, 26, is married and has three children, ages 2, 3 and 5. Two are going to school. He has three additional dependents who live with him because they are younger ones who he assists in their schooling and they do some domestic work at home. In 2005, Ibrahim established his provisions business selling baby food, beverages, condiments, etc. He began his business because he assisted his father after school hours and when his father died, there was no sponsorship for his schooling. He joined his elder brother in business and after some years his brother gave him money to start his own business which has now grown into two outlets.
Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 3,681,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy Ovaltine (10 cartons @ Le90,000), peak milk (10 cartons @ Le260,000), energy drinks (20 cartons @ Le23,000), Heineken (15 cartons @ Le75,000), sardines (five cartons @ Le160,000) and pure water (38 bundles @ Le3,000). The balance of Le1,000 will be used to pay a laborer. In the future, Ibrahim plans to provide quality education for his children, build a house and become an international businessman. This loan will help to increase his income. Inadequate capital is his major challenge. He is a hard-working and honest businessman. He hopes to repay this loan and access another. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Ovaltine, peak milk, energy drinks, Heineken, sardines and pure water and also to pay a laborer.

loans.name: 040310Thôn Thành Xuân - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghĩa operates a business selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net for fishing.

Nghĩa is 42 years old, and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 040310 Thôn Thành Xuân - Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 

Nghĩa supports 2 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She also has another child, who is grown up.

In 2002, Nghĩa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Nghĩa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nghĩa hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net for fishing

loans.name: Oerm

texts.en:
Oerm, a 27-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two children to take care of, and they are in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for ten years and also makes and sells grilled sticky rice. Her husband earns additional income by working as a motor-taxi driver in the local area. 

Her husband’s old motorbike is breaks down too often, which has the effect of making the family's income unstable. In order to solve this problem, she is applying for a loan of US $1,000 from VisionFund to purchase a decent motorbike for her husband’s business. This is the first loan for Oerm with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She hopes this loan will help her husband generate a larger income from his motorbike transportation business. This will help the family improve its standard of living and keep the children in school.

loans.use: To purchase a decent motorbike for her husband’s business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Ibrahim II. He is married and has four children aged 8, 12, 14 and 17 years, all attending school. In 1995, Ibrahim II established his business selling second-hand school bags and building materials. He began his business because his father was a farmer, and going to school was not an option as the farm needed his help. He worked through his teenage years in the village with his family, and then decided to join a friend in Makeni Town in his second-hand business.

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, Ibrahim II earns about Le 875,000 every month, usually selling his goods to peddlers and passersby. Shortage of supplies is his major problem. Having already received and repaid three loans, he is now requesting a new one for Le 4,000,000 to purchase the following: second-hand bags - 3 bales @ Le1,000,000; locks - 1 carton @ Le400,000; shine papers - 2 rolls @ Le150,000, and nails - 1 carton @ Le300,000.

Hardworking and reliable, Ibrahim II hopes to continue with this credit service so that he can develop himself. The loan will help as he is progressing gradually. In the future, he hopes to be supplier. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase second handed bags - 3 bales @ Le1,000,000, locks - 1 carton @ Le400,000, shine papers - 2 rolls @ Le150,000 and nails - 1 cartons @ Le300,000.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 53-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has no children. In 2010, Mohamed established his provision business. He began his business because he wants to develop his family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Mohamed now requires a new loan in order to buy more provisions of different types. In the future, Mohamed plans to give a good education to his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase his stock in very large quantities

loans.name: Pasuc Group

texts.es:
El señor Martin Encarnacion esta unido de hecho, tiene 25 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijo, el cual aun no están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, como son, pantalones y camisa, inicio este trabajo trabajando con una maquina mecánica y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran, para la compra de una maquina industrial, la cual les permitirá aumentar su nivel de producción y desempeños, esperan en el futuro tener una maquila propio y con empleados. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la confección de prendas.
texts.en:
Martín Encarnación, 25, is actually in a relationship and has a son not yet attending school; he completed third grade.  He works sewing fabrics like pants and shirts.  He started the business with a standard sewing machine and to date has six years’ experience. He gets help from his wife who does the same kind of work.

He organized a group to request a loan that will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine that will allow them to increase production and jobs.  They hope in future to have an assembly plant of their own with employees.  

The other group members work raising animals and making clothes.

loans.use: to buy an industrial machine.

loans.name: Zainab O.

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Zainab O. She is married and has one child who is 15 years old and attends school. She has two additional dependents who live with her to be fostered. In 2010, Zainab O. established her business selling household utensils. She began her business as she dropped out of school because of having a single parent. She used to assist her father after school hours. When she became an adult, she got married, and because her husband knows her business background he established a business for her. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 3,252,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Zainab O. requires a loan in order to purchase the following:
  • pans - 25 sets @ 70,000 SLL
  • stoves - 10 pieces @ 60,000 SLL
  • coolman - 15 pieces @ 90,000 SLL
  • glass cups - 3 dozen @ 96,000 SLL
The balance, 12,000 SLL, will be used to pay laborers. In the future, Zainab O. plans to build a house, acquire another outlet, and provide a quality education for her children. This loan will help to increase her stock. Some items are fragile and will get spoiled easily. She is a hardworking business woman. She thanks ARD for providing additional capital for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase pans (25 sets @ 70,000 SLL), stoves (10 pieces @ 60,000 SLL), coolman (15 pieces @ 90,000 SLL), and glass cups (3 dozen @ 96,000 SLL). The balance, 12,000 SLL, will be used to pay laborers.

loans.name: Emiro Rafael

texts.es: Emiro  de 33 años de edad, se dedica al lavado de motocicletas, negocio con el que ha logrado sostener su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 2 a 11 años. A Emiro los conductores de este vehículo, le llevan sus motocicletas para para que además de lavárselas, les aplique cera. Últimamente los clientes de Emiro, son mucho más y su máquina no alcanza a cubrir rápidamente esta demanda; esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando aun credikiva, con el cual comprará una máquina para lavar y trabajar con más  holgado. Emiro está muy satisfecho con su negocio, pues el cumple el propósito por el cual lo creó, que fue el de generar ingresos para tener cada vez mas, bienestar para su familia. Sus principales clientes son los mototransportadores, a quienes atiende diariamente durante todo el día, pero todo su trabajo lo hace con mucho empeño y dedicación.
texts.en: Emiro, 33, works washing motorcycles, a business that allows him to support his home composed of his spouse and four children ranging in age from 2 to 11.  Motorcycle drivers bring their cycles to Emiro so that in addition to washing them he’ll wax them.  Lately, Emiro’s clientele has grown much and he can’t cover demand fast enough.  This is the reason he’s applying for a Kiva loan so that he can buy a machine to wash them with and work more efficiently.  Emiro is very satisfied with his business because it meets the purpose for which he created it which was to generate income so that his family would be better off every day.  His main customers are transportation providers who he tends to all day, every day but with much dedication and attention to detail.

loans.use: to buy a machine to wash vehicles.

loans.name: Zainab Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Zainab. She is married and has 4 children, ages 11 months, 8, 11, and 19. Two are school-going children. She has two additional dependents who live with her to be fostered. In 2010, Zainab established her household utensils business. She began her business because she dropped out of school at Form II level, and her parents gave her in marriage to a businessman. Her husband gave her some money to start a business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,559,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Zainab requires a loan in order to buy the following items:
  • coolman - 15 pieces @ 130,000 SLL
  • flasks - 16 pieces @ 40,000 SLL
  • set pans - 1 dozen @ 960,000 SLL
  • glass cups - 6 dozen @ 72,000 SLL
  • plastic plates - 1 dozen @ 18,000 SLL
In the future, Zainab plans to build a house, educate her children, open another outlet, and become an international businesswoman. This loan will help her achieve some of her future plans. Her current problems include inadequate capital and the fact that some items, like set pans, will get damaged when traveling. She is a hardworking and honest businesswoman. She hopes to repay the loan and access another. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy coolman (15 pieces @ 130,000 SLL), flasks (16 pieces @ 40,000 SLL), set pans (1 dozen @ 960,000 SLL), glass cups (6 dozen @ 72,000 SLL), and plastic plates (1 dozen @ 18,000 SLL).

loans.name: Banco Mujer La Rosa Group

texts.es: Lucia es una mujer de 49, viuda, y madre de 2 hijos, ambos mayores de 25 años.
